7:28.race_name: Download The Raceday Ready App Handicap
7:28.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (Rail Movements: 6.53, 8.03 & 8.38 +12yds)

runners.name: Honour Your Dreams
runners.comment: Been found a couple of less-competitive handicaps lately; will be 2lb lower from tomorrow
runners.spotlight: Has been found a couple of less-competitive handicaps lately and he isn't well in under the penalty, with him set to be 2lb lower from tomorrow; having Kaiya Fraser take off 3lb won't hurt, though, and he's adaptable regarding the ground.

runners.name: Keldeo
runners.owner: Ownaracehorse, O Pears And T&T Racing
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner last year, each time off 3lb lower; in fine form this spring; player
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner last year (good and soft), each time off 3lb lower; in fine form this spring, latterly off this mark from a wide stall at Beverley, and looks set to go well once more.

quotes.race: EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Band D) (EBF Restricted Race Qualifier) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Keldeo has come forward from her debut. She ran a nice race at Catterick but just got tired late. She has a lot of scope and should make a cracking three-year-old too and I'm very hopeful for her future prospects - Ollie Pears, trainer.

runners.name: Albegone
runners.owner: D B & Mrs C Lamplough & Partner
runners.comment: Won this race last year, one of three C&D victories; high in the weights but in good form
runners.spotlight: Won this race last year, one of three C&D victories, and the recent rain was perfectly timed for him; he's never won off a mark quite this high but returns to his favourite course in good form.

runners.name: Good Point
runners.comment: Interesting to see how he goes in the market after more than seven months off
runners.spotlight: Showed enough during a limited campaign last year to suggest he's up to featuring off a career-low mark if ready to go after more than seven months off; interesting to see how he goes in the market.

runners.name: Flowstate
runners.comment: Soft-ground winner on debut last summer; would want to see market confidence on drop to 5f
runners.spotlight: Soft-ground winner on debut last summer, which gives hope back from seven months off; held a few times in handicaps latterly, though, and has only run over 6f to date, so would want to see a bit of market confidence on the drop to 5f.

runners.name: Glory Fighter
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs P Hopper & Mr & Mrs M Morris
runners.comment: Won this two years ago and has a few C&D near-misses to his name too; claims
runners.spotlight: Won this two years ago and has a few C&D near-misses to his name too; a 6lb rise for recent Nottingham victory leaves little room for manoeuvre but he helps give Paul Midgley, who also runs Birkenhead, a decent hand.

quotes.race: Chester Rugby Club Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: That was a good performance from Glory Fighter. I tucked in on the rail and got a good run round. I had lots of horse left and he hit the line nicely - Callum Rodriguez, rider.

runners.name: Birkenhead
runners.comment: Took his record over C&D to 4-8 when going in off 5lb lower last month; can't be ruled out
runners.spotlight: Took his record over C&D to 4-8 when going in off 5lb lower last month; backed that up when second at Ripon three weeks ago and, with all ground conditions coming alike, he enters the equation.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Birkenhead really loves it there and saves his best for the track. We've had him a few seasons now and he's been great. He's a fantastic little horse who pays his way and he's one of them who just loves life and is easy to train. For these older horses, soundness is the key. If they're sound they keep giving and they keep lasting; if they're not then they don't do that. I thought he was big enough [odds], but I thought he was that price because of his draw in stall ten. Between myself and Oisin [McSweeney, jockey], we made the plan to go down the middle of the track and he was always in control - Paul Midgley, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet "Jump Jockeys' Nunthorpe" Handicap (To Be Ridden By Professional Jump Jockeys)
quotes.quote: It took a while for BIRKENHEAD to click but he's not done anything wrong since-Paul Midgley, trainer

stable_tour.quote: We bought him off Les Eyre and he wasn't a lot of money, and if you'd said to me a fortnight after we bought him that he would win the jump jockeys' race at York, I'd have said you were on a different planet. He's a funny little horse; when he's in form, he's in form, and when he isn't in form, he isn't. He's really easy to train and he's been great but he's frustrating at times as he does what he likes. To be fair to him, he's a fast-ground horse but he won on soft at Catterick the time before last. It was soft ground that you could go through and a few of the fancied ones didn't run because the ground changed overnight and we thought we'd got nothing to lose. We'd got an outside stall, where we could get over to the golden highway, and the worst thing we could do was get beat. After about a furlong, he was never going to get beat. We tried to do the same there last time but he just got beat by a progressive one of Bryan Smart's. He's paying his way, whiis great, and hopefully he'll continue to do so. 28-06-24

runners.name: Maris Angel
runners.comment: Didn't look to see out a stiff 5f last time; 2lb lower tonight and needs considering
runners.spotlight: Went off favourite at Beverley recently when back from four months off but she didn't look to see out that stiff 5f (dual winner from the front over easier courses last autumn); 2lb lower tonight, under 5lb claimer Warren Fentiman, and needs considering.

6:53.race_name: Netherfield FC Team Of 1990 Reunion Handicap
6:53.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (Rail Movements: 6.53, 8.03 & 8.38 +12yds)

runners.name: Gastronomy
runners.comment: Couple of decent efforts over C&D; cheekpieces are given a second try and he's considered
runners.spotlight: Used to running in slightly better company and has a couple of decent efforts to his name over C&D, latterly 18 days ago (winner gone in again since); cheekpieces are given a second try and he's considered.

runners.name: Star Legend
runners.comment: No penalty for last Thursday's easy AW apprentice race victory so 5lb well-in; player
runners.spotlight: No penalty for last Thursday's easy Chelmsford apprentice race victory and is 5lb well-in; last three wins, including two over hurdles, have come when switching headgear but his claims are obvious.

stable_tour.quote: He was quite a shock winner at Fakenham last time but he'd just dropped into a lower grade. He does really well around Fakenham, which is really nice as it's a track I love supporting. We've just set up a syndicate to sell him to more local people, which will mean he'll keep running at local tracks like Fakenham and Huntingdon. 01-01-25

runners.name: Agathon
runners.comment: Cheekpieces have made the difference and he remains low mileage; set to go well again
runners.spotlight: Cheekpieces have made the difference and he'll be 1lb higher from tomorrow following last Friday's Pontefract near-miss; return to this longer trip looks in his favour, with Kaiya Fraser taking 3lb off, and he remains low mileage.

runners.name: Stellarmasterpiece

prev_owners.owner: Paulina Gorczyca, Mustardos P Gorczyca & K & L Radwanscy

runners.comment: Didn't take to hurdles and been much happier back round here this spring; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Didn't take to hurdles and been much happier back round here this spring; this is a bit stronger than the 1m4f handicap in which she finished second last month but she looks set to go well once more.

runners.name: Stand Strong
runners.owner: A Whillans, W Orr, C Spark, J Wright
runners.comment: Offered more latest and 6lb better off with third-placed Agathon, so a case could be made
runners.spotlight: Tumbled down the weights for this yard having missed almost two years; offered more latest, going this far for the first time, and is 6lb better off with third-placed Agathon, so a case could be made.

runners.name: Queen Roslyn
runners.comment: Poor effort when well below market expectations on her AW handicap debut over a year ago
runners.spotlight: Another poor effort when well below market expectations on her AW handicap debut; that came well over a year ago and would want to see some market interest before adding her in to calculations.

8:38.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (Rail Movements: 6.53, 8.03 & 8.38 +12yds)

runners.name: Mersea
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Saint-Vincent & E A R
runners.comment: February win came off the back of an absence and she's capable back at this level
runners.spotlight: Ran well over C&D (heavy) last spring and her Tapeta win in February came off the back of an absence, so there are no worries on that front; hasn't been the most consistent in latter times but is capable back at this level.

quotes.race: Fred Says Don't Fall 80th Birthday Handicap
quotes.quote: We loved Mersea at two and she got a little bit of an injury at York when she was giving weight to The Platinum Queen. She wasn't training with her usual exuberance earlier on in the year so we've been patient. We could see her drop back to five furlongs as she did everything wrong today - Sam's instructions were to sit fourth or fifth but he couldn't! I've got her pencilled in to return to Carlisle for a five-furlong race on September 1. I think she'll win again before the end of the year - Nick Bradley.

quotes.race: No.1 York By Guesthouse Hotels British EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mersea's attitude is probably her best attribute and she was never going to be beaten, I always had my rivals measure. It's so impressive she's that tough, especially as a juvenile - Sam James, jockey

stable_tour.quote: I thought a lot of her last year when she managed to win back-to-back races at Carlisle and York, where she defied a 6lb penalty. Things didn't fall right in her first three runs this year as she was outpaced at York and then at Doncaster the ground was too soft. However, she had been showing me shades of the old Mersea at home in recent weeks and I felt she had a big shout last week at Carlisle. She set off at the front and quickened nicely 2f out to win by three-quarters of a length. She looked like a 5f horse in a 6f race and we got away with it. She's in at Carlisle on Friday over 5f with a penalty and this would be her last chance for a while to run in a 0-75, so if the ground is riding fast I think she'll go there. She's still on a very nice mark. 30-08-23

runners.name: Wichahpi
runners.comment: Made all when winning off 7lb lower on soft over C&D this time last year; can do better
runners.spotlight: Made all when winning off 7lb lower over C&D on soft ground this time last year; didn't offer a lot on her comeback last month but will have appreciated the recent rain.

quotes.race: Leicester Racecourse Ideal Self-Hire Wedding Venue Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a good effort from Wichahpi. The cheekpieces have done her no harm since they were applied and the race went perfectly for her. She kept finding and was suited by the slow ground - Graham Lee, rider.

runners.name: A Girl Named Ivy
runners.comment: 2lb lower than when springing a surprise at Pontefract last summer; needs to settle better
runners.spotlight: Serial hard puller who's tended to stick to fast ground and may not have wanted the rain; now 2lb lower than when springing a surprise at Pontefract last summer but needs to settle better.

stable_tour.quote: She has won twice this season, each time at a big price. She won her maiden at Ayr at 50-1 in May and then won at Pontefract this month at 33-1. She's been a difficult one as she's not big but is very stocky. She wasn't really ready for racing as a two-year-old. She ran once and then we put her away. She won first time out this year and then the ground was maybe a bit quick for her at Thirsk. Then she won at Pontefract but ran badly again back there the other day, finishing last. She's prone to tying up a bit with her muscles and I think this is a problem we've got to work through. Maybe we'll give her a bit more time between her races so that she doesn't tie up. I'll keep her at 6f. 28-08-24

runners.name: Patontheback
runners.comment: Back on his last successful mark but finished well held over C&D last time
runners.spotlight: Last three wins, including here, came over 7f and there's nothing to suggest that either 6f, or the recent rain, is likely to prove ideal; back on his last successful mark but finished well held over C&D last time.

quotes.race: Congratulations Erin On Getting Married Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Patontheback had a lovely run round. I thought if he doesn't win today he's never going to as everything went perfect for him. He slid down to a handy mark, things haven't worked out his way but he hasn't done much wrong - Gemma Tutty, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He had a great time last year, winning twice over 7f and being placed on several other occasions. Hopefully he'll be able to ply his trade in the summer handicaps. He ran well on all sorts of different tracks last season, so we can be fairly flexible with him and he didn't run at all badly at Thirsk on Tuesday. 23-04-25

runners.name: Glory Hyde
runners.comment: Run exclusively over 5f for the past year; expensive to follow lately and needs more
runners.spotlight: Hasn't run over 6f in over a year and didn't look to have any excuses when twice getting turned over as favourite this spring, latterly over 5f at Ripon 12 days ago; needs to find more.

runners.name: Crocodile Power
runners.comment: Currently 3-4 over C&D and now 1lb lower than when last successful (soft); player
runners.spotlight: 3-4 over C&D and now 1lb lower than for his latest win (soft) in October; found traffic over 5f last month before pulling too hard here latest and, with the recent rain in his favour, he's capable of better.

runners.name: Quercus
runners.comment: Five-time C&D winner; been taken out a few times in the past on account of soft ground
runners.spotlight: Five-time C&D winner, all from the front, who's been taken out a few times in the past on account of soft ground, so could have done without the rain; well handicapped but is getting on and lacks consistency now.

quotes.race: 5th Regiment Royal Artillery Handicap
quotes.quote: Quercus just loves it here. The track suits him and while we call him 'quirky quirk' at home, he's actually really genuine. There was another race for him on the card, but this looked easier and it was worth it. There's a race here next week which looks like it'll be for him, so we'll be back then - Ann Duffield, trainer.

runners.name: Dream Deal
runners.comment: Held at a short price over C&D latest; may not have been best served by the rain coming
runners.spotlight: Solid C&D comeback for new yard but didn't back it up at a short price here latest; again without the cheekpieces usually worn for Danny Brooke, has been expensive to follow and may not have been best served by the rain coming.

runners.name: Starsong

prev_owners.owner: Mrs J E Mulhern & David S McGuinness

runners.comment: Return to 6f looks in her favour but it's hard to be sure the rain will have helped
runners.spotlight: Four-time AW winner who's been in fair form on turf lately without the usual headgear; the return to 6f looks in her favour but she was withdrawn on account of soft ground in her Irish days, so it's hard to be sure the rain will have helped.

5:43.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (Rail Movements: 6.53, 8.03 & 8.38 +12yds)

runners.name: Dandys Rocket
runners.comment: Perhaps today's easier 5f will help but he'll need another decent forward step
runners.spotlight: Needed his debut experience and fared better last time; perhaps today's easier 5f will help but he'll need another decent forward step if he's to take this.

runners.name: Gaga Mate
runners.owner: Hold My Beer, D Cunha, M Broughton
runners.comment: First foal of an Irish 5f winner (soft); holds two sales race entries later in the season
runners.spotlight: First foal of an Irish 5f winner (soft) who holds a couple of sales race entries later in the season; trainer's sole 2yo runner this year won second time out; interesting newcomer.

runners.name: Hanney Girl
runners.comment: Pulled hard and was eased late following her jockey losing an iron at halfway on debut
runners.spotlight: Pulled hard and was eased late following her jockey losing an iron at halfway on debut a month ago; started 66-1 that day but wasn't beaten far all things considered.

runners.name: Homestrait
runners.comment: Trainer boasts a fair record with 2yos here down the years and she sets the standard
runners.spotlight: Ran way above market expectations when a clear second on her Beverley debut, and did so again at the same course last time; trainer boasts a fair record with 2yos here down the years and she sets the standard.

runners.name: No Claims Bonus
runners.comment: This is more realistic in a first-time hood now she's gained some experience
runners.spotlight: Tough task on her Goodwood debut four weeks ago, when showing bright speed before fading to finish last; this is more realistic in a first-time hood now she's gained some experience.

runners.name: Star Marian
runners.comment: Excuses on debut; into calmer waters and one of the likelier winners from the inside stall
runners.spotlight: Well held in the end on her Chester debut but she was drawn wide, lost a shoe and didn't see it out over 5.5f; into calmer waters today and is one of the likelier winners from the inside stall.

runners.name: The Little Bear
runners.comment: Shaped nicely having raced wide and off the pace on AW debut; will have learned from that
runners.spotlight: April-foaled half-sister to two early juvenile winners; started 33-1 for her debut (yard not noted for 2yos) at Wolverhampton 18 days ago, when shaping nicely having raced wide and off the pace; will have learned plenty from that.

8:03.race_name: Bet At racingtv.com Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
8:03.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (Rail Movements: 6.53, 8.03 & 8.38 +12yds)

runners.name: Pianoforte
runners.comment: Trainer doesn't run many here; just about sets the standard; market can give some clues
runners.spotlight: Not seen since last April and it's eye-catching that he's been persevered with by a trainer who doesn't run many here; just about sets the standard and the market should give some clues.

runners.name: Farandaway
runners.comment: Career-best form over 5f (good) here last weekend; pulled hard in two previous 6f runs
runners.spotlight: Turned in a career-best over 5f (good) here last weekend, albeit it's hard to know what to make of that effort; pulled hard in two previous runs over 6f and hasn't always appealed as the easiest of rides.

runners.name: Reddeef
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: Exposed; switches from cheekpieces to a visor tonight for a yard that's 3-7 with 3yos here
runners.spotlight: Easy to back when comfortably held on AW comeback last month, having been gelded, and is looking exposed now; switches from cheekpieces to a visor for a yard, also represented by Takteek,  that's 3-7 with 3yos here.

runners.name: Sand Sea
runners.comment: Yard has the occasional winning newcomer and the market tends to be a useful guide
runners.spotlight: Gelded 2,000gns yearling whose dam was successful at around this trip; yard has the occasional winning newcomer and the market tends to be a useful guide.

runners.name: Takteek
runners.comment: Well beaten on his recent 6f AW debut; may be one for handicaps over further in due course
runners.spotlight: Half-brother Rawaasi gained his sole win over 8.6f and this gelding may be one for handicaps over further in due course, having finished well beaten on recent 6f AW debut; goes in first-time headgear for a trainer also responsible for Reddeef.

runners.name: The Sweet Escape
runners.comment: Didn't see it out from the front latest; may find life easier in handicaps after tonight
runners.spotlight: Hung right on his 7f AW debut, also going this way round, before not seeing it out from the front over 6f latest; may find life easier in handicap company after tonight.

runners.name: Wicket Keeper

runners.spotlight: Needed the experience when shaping nicely in a Newbury maiden (6f, good) in October that's produced plenty of winners; since picked up for 45,000gns from Eve Johnson Houghton and gelded;  interesting contender.

runners.name: Kennedys Pass
runners.owner: Mps Racing Ltd & The Ayrshire Tradesmen
runners.comment: Big prices and well beaten in two runs this month, latterly behind Tanjen
runners.spotlight: Big prices and well beaten in two runs this month, latterly behind Tanjen; low-grade handicaps are likely next up.

runners.name: Little Beck Annie
runners.comment: 50-1 for her Tapeta debut last November, when always well behind after a slow start
runners.spotlight: 50-1 for her Tapeta debut last November, when always well behind after a slow start.

runners.name: Tanjen
runners.comment: Plenty of toe but pulled too hard in front when well fancied last time; needs to settle
runners.spotlight: Made a lot of the running when shaping fairly well at 100-1 on her Doncaster debut, but then pulled too hard in front when well fancied last time (both 6f); useful half-sister She's Quality was best over 5f and no surprise to see her follow suit.

6:18.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (Rail Movements: 6.53, 8.03 & 8.38 +12yds)

runners.name: Secret Dreamer
runners.comment: Starts handicap life at a lowly level in first-time blinkers and is one to consider
runners.spotlight: Again went left, and again didn't see out 6f, last time, but starts handicap life at a lowly level in first-time blinkers and has a rail nearby on her left-hand side from stall 4; worth considering, especially should the market speak her way.

runners.name: Wee Mary
runners.comment: Came well away from the rest with Cheerleader (6lb better off) last Monday; leading claims
runners.spotlight: Came well away from the rest with Cheerleader at Redcar last Monday, having made most of the running in a first-time hood, and is due to go up 2lb from tomorrow; tonight's easy 5f from a handy draw should be right up her street.

runners.name: Cheerleader

prev_owners.owner: My Future Champion & Mrs E Burke

runners.comment: Popped up at 66-1 latest, coming well away with Wee Mary; rain a concern under the penalty
runners.spotlight: Plenty of chances for Karl Burke and not much was expected for her new yard at Redcar last Monday, but she popped up at 66-1, coming right away with Wee Mary; recent rain maybe wasn't ideal and she needs to back that up on 6lb worse terms.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Handicap
quotes.quote: You've never entirely sure but we were quietly confident. Cheerleader came to us in November and she's had a great winter running about the fields and we gave her time to settle in. She's grown over the winter and her homework has been really good, so we're delighted. She's a good filly to have about, she's no bother and is an easy ride ? I ride her a lot at home, so she needs to be quiet! She was fit enough to do herself justice and we're looking at a three-year-old race at Catterick over five furlongs next, which is the trip we'd want to keep her at for now - Tina Jackson, trainer.

runners.name: Queen Dinah
runners.comment: Gone backwards and again well held on her first start since undergoing wind surgery latest
runners.spotlight: Gone backwards and again finished well held on her first start since undergoing wind surgery three weeks ago; goes in first-time headgear now having a first run over 5f.

runners.name: Zivas Star
runners.comment: Still to finish placed and is having a first run over 5f; some way down the pecking order
runners.spotlight: Trainer gained most wins with older horses and this maiden, who's still to finish placed and is having a first run over 5f, will do well to bolster an ordinary recent strike-rate with 3yos.

runners.name: Baby Rover
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And Partner
runners.comment: Slight surprise to see the cheekpieces off; needs more again back from an eight-week break
runners.spotlight: Maiden who's fared better in a couple of low-grade Tapeta handicaps since fitted with cheekpieces (removed this evening); needs more again back from an eight-week break.

stable_tour.quote: An interesting horse as she's Curious Rover's full-sister. She has started to come to hand and we like what we're seeing. We expect her to be on the track in August. 14-06-24

runners.name: Writteninthestars
runners.comment: Big prices and well beaten in three runs last year; would want to see good support
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to 7f Polytrack winner God Bless America who started at big prices and finished well beaten in three runs last year; would want to see good support before considering him.

1:55.race_name: Dragonbet Proud Sponsors Of Chepstow Racecourse Apprentice Handicap
1:55.going_detailed: Straight course - GOOD, Good to soft in places; Round course - GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places

runners.name: Gallant Lion
runners.comment: Mostly in the doldrums since 4 wins in 2023; disappointing favourite latest; headgear on
runners.spotlight: All four wins in 2023, at 1m2f and about 1m3f on ground ranging from good to soft to good to firm; mostly in the doldrums since and was a long way from justifying favouritism at Newbury recently when the good, good to firm in places ground was held to be unsuitable; first-time headgear.

runners.name: Al Khawaneej River
runners.breeder: S A S Ecurie De Cachene & Jean-Paul Lem
runners.comment: Handles most ground; off the mark at Windsor (about 1m3f) in May; off since August
runners.spotlight: Acts on heavy and his Windsor win (about 1m3f) last May came on good ground; has been off since August but he's only lightly raced and there could be more to come as 4yo.

runners.name: V Power
runners.comment: Pulled up over hurdles in December; has possibilities on best 1m4f form on AW and turf
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on handicap hurdle debut when last seen in December but he's only lightly raced on the Flat and has possibilities on his best 1m4f form on the AW and turf in 2024; not ruled out.

runners.name: Cherryhawk
runners.comment: Just 1lb higher than for C&D win on soft last May but career has gone south since
runners.spotlight: In good form this time last year when winning over C&D (soft) but her career has gone south since, including over hurdles this year; just 1lb higher than for the win but revival desperately needed.

stable_tour.quote: She's also threatening to win a race. She's a homebred half-sister to Cherry Hill. She loves the soft ground. Her conformation in front isn't brilliant and I'd never run her on quick ground. She could run on the all-weather but I'd love to find a handicap for her on soft ground before the end of the year. 21-09-23

runners.name: Pub Crawl

prev_owners.owner: Mrs I Corbani & Mrs E O'Leary

runners.comment: Should be a shoo-in for 1m4f race on old form but 0-27 after pulled up over hurdles latest
runners.spotlight: Ought to be a shoo-in for a 1m4f race off his current mark but he hasn't run on turf for nearly two years and he made it 0-27 overall when pulled up over hurdles recently; tongue-tie/blinkers abandoned.

runners.name: Marioento
runners.breeder: Normandie Stud Ltd & Star Pointe Ltd
runners.comment: Sole win at about 1m1f on AW but stays well and acts on good to soft; major chance
runners.spotlight: Sole win over an extended 1m1f on the AW in February but he stays much further and wasn't beaten by a lack of stamina when third at Salisbury (1m6f, good to firm; first-time blinkers, retained) last week; acts on good to soft and major claims down in grade.

runners.name: Bye Bye Salam
runners.owner: D Smith & Hudson Plumbing And Heating
runners.comment: Well-connected 4yo; showed more on handicap debut (1m4f, AW); open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Well-connected 4yo who showed a bit more on his handicap debut at Kempton (1m4f, AW) last month when the run might well have been needed; looks open to improvement back on turf.

runners.name: Beggarman
runners.owner: Mrs E Bickerton And A Streeter
runners.comment: All 4 wins on AW; two close calls on turf (1m6f) in 2024; likely contender
runners.spotlight: All four wins on the AW and although he's 0-19 on turf he had two close calls at 1m6f on turf (good to soft and good) off this mark in 2024; ran respectably on recent AW return from a break; likely contender.

stable_tour.quote: He's a quirky old soldier. He does his best not to win, but did win one race early last season at Chelmsford. He was a bit more backward when he came in this year, so we gave him a run to straighten him up. Hopefully he'll win his one race again, but he's very good at coming second. He's entered at Lingfield and Chepstow later in the week. 29-04-25

runners.name: Curtiz
runners.comment: Losing turf run goes back to 2021; best at up to 1m2f; lots to prove over 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Losing run on turf goes back to 2021 and his best form is at up to 1m2f; well held when favourite over that trip at Windsor recently and has much to prove back over 1m4f; yard also runs Beggarman.

stable_tour.quote: He's getting a bit long in the tooth now. He runs his race, but I think the days of him winning three on the trot have gone. It would be nice for him to win another race, but I suspect we should be grateful for all the seconds and thirds he gets - he had another at Windsor last time. 29-05-25

runners.name: Fast Affair
runners.comment: Two AW wins for J Fanshawe, over 1m1f and 1m; off since last June
runners.spotlight: Her two wins for James Fanshawe came at about 1m1f and 1m on AW, most recently last June; sold 16,000gns the following month; stayed 1m3f on the AW but she has much to prove this time.

runners.name: Run Of Luck
runners.breeder: E De Giles &  C Shand Kydd
runners.comment: Has won 2 of his last 3 turf starts at 1m2f; new trip but bred to stay this far
runners.spotlight: Below best on AW recently but he'd been improving on turf previously, winning two of his three previous starts at 1m2f with varying tactics, at Bath (good) in September and Doncaster (good to soft) in March; dam bred four middle-distance winners and this one's of interest up in trip.

3:25.race_name: Dragonbet Born From The Betting Ring Handicap
3:25.going_detailed: Straight course - GOOD, Good to soft in places; Round course - GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places

runners.name: The Coffee Pod
runners.comment: Quirky but he's better than this level and his latest Windsor third was more encouraging
runners.spotlight: Has his quirks but he's a useful sprinter on his day, certainly better than this level; best effort in 2025 when keeping on for third at Windsor 11 days ago (5f, good to firm); strong claims if breaking on terms.

quotes.race: Ire Incentive, It Pays To Buy Irish EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: The Coffee Pod was third in the Hornblower last time to a couple of good horses, but we thought this would suit him. Richard says he wants 7f, maybe a mile eventually, so we might step him up next time. We've got the job done and hopefully go on from there - Tim Palin, racing director of Middleham Park Racing, owners.

runners.name: Connies Rose
runners.comment: Won this race last year; two good course runs were followed by a lesser effort at Bath
runners.spotlight: Three wins last year, including this race off a 2lb lower mark (good to soft); two good course runs preceded a quiet effort at Bath one week ago; can bounce back but stable may have stronger claims with So Smart.

quotes.race: HAC Plumbing Supplies Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Connie's Rose loves racing - there is no mare tougher.  She has a good routine at home - she doesn't do a lot or see another horse - and she's a joy to train.  I'm still undecided if she prefers 5f.  We thought she was going to be a 1m-plus horse as she was slow, green and didn't know how to gallop at all, but she got a lot quicker at home.  Would we get more improvement holding her up at 1m?  We don't know.  We may try it in future but we don't want to change anything that's working at the moment - Grace Harris, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: So Smart
runners.comment: C&D winner; impressive from a poor draw at Lingfield before a lesser run on Monday
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; showed fine early speed when getting across from stall 1 to win a Lingfield handicap three weeks ago (5f, good to firm; next five home drawn 12, 10, 13, 9 and 14); couldn't sustain his effort when fifth at Windsor on Monday but he's still a lively contender this time.

quotes.race: Betting.Bet Live Racing Results Handicap
quotes.quote: He pinged the gates but did find the ground on the quick side, So Smart changed leads a couple of times but got away with it in the end. He likes to front-run because when he's in behind he doesn't do a whole lot, if something comes to him he goes again. He's an older horse so it's good to change things (headgear) and it's worked tonight - Kieran O'Neill, jockey, speaking to Sky Racing.

runners.name: Secret Handsheikh
runners.comment: Multiple winner, including C&D, and handles any ground; high on the list from a good draw
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner, including C&D, who handles any ground; good second at Windsor last month but not quite so good when turned out at Brighton just two days later; fair chance he'll grab the stands' rail (if desired) and he's high on the list.

quotes.race: Get Your Ladbrokes Daily Odds Boost Handicap
quotes.quote: Secret Handsheikh was a convincing winner last time and went up 9lb but he loves this surface. He skips off the surface and has such a good attitude - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

runners.name: Joy Choi
runners.comment: Well held in two runs this year but there are grounds for expecting better today
runners.spotlight: Two of her three wins have come at this track and on soft ground; she hasn't beaten a rival in her two starts this season but they were on quick ground and she could prove a different proposition following the recent rain; handy mark and rider's claim useful too.

runners.name: Moes Legacy
runners.comment: Struggled in four runs following AW win in November; others bring more compelling claims
runners.spotlight: 2lb lower than for her AW win in November but she's struggled in four runs since; others bring more compelling claims.

runners.name: Some Nightmare
runners.owner: Mrs S M Maine & Roger Gould & Partner

prev_owners.owner: Mrs S M Maine & The Cross Racing Club
N G H Ayliffe,Mrs S M Maine & Partner

runners.comment: Four course wins; good run on penultimate start but less convincing latest; dangerous mark
runners.spotlight: Four course wins, the latest over this trip last September off 3lb higher; ran well at Windsor on his penultimate start but not in the same form back there 18 days ago; course record means he needs a second look.

runners.name: Willingly

prev_owners.owner: Lee Thompson, Katy Bird, Jacintha Hynes
Lee Thompson, Katy Bird, Jas Hynes

runners.comment: Out of sorts on last four starts; dangerous mark back sprinting and rain a plus
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; on a losing run but she's thrown in on last season's best, even from 3lb out of the weights; ended 2024 under a cloud though and remote in two AW runs this year; return to sprinting on rain-softened ground will help but there are risks; blinkers return.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Twitter @leicesterraces Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Willingly loves this ground. She's fast out of the stalls and likes to bowl along. If the ground stays soft enough hopefully she can win again - Tyler Heard, jockey.

quotes.race: Quinnbet Casino Classified Stakes (Div I)
quotes.quote: That was my first ever ride at Yarmouth so it's great it was a winner. I rode Willingly last time at Salisbury and thought she had a race in her. There were a few fancied in it - Owen Lewis, rider.

2:55.race_name: Pricing By Real Bookmakers At Dragonbet Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
2:55.going_detailed: Straight course - GOOD, Good to soft in places; Round course - GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places

runners.name: George Sansevero
runners.comment: Dam 5f-7f winner (RPR 85); 100-1 and trailed in last over 1m at Bath where also hooded
runners.spotlight: Dam 5f-7f winner (RPR 85); 100-1 and trailed in last over 1m at Bath where also hooded.

runners.name: Paps Of Jura
runners.comment: Signs of inexperience but was totally tailed off at Salisbury only two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Signs of inexperience but was totally tailed off at Salisbury only two weeks ago (1m2f, good to firm; 66-1).

runners.name: Sweet Nightingale
runners.comment: Led early but ended up last at Salisbury (1m2f) after a mammoth absence
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler but at a modest level; led early but ended up last at Salisbury (1m2f) after a mammoth absence.

runners.name: Lasswade
runners.comment: Finished last in two 7f maidens on the AW late last year; gelded since
runners.spotlight: Finished last in two 7f maidens on the AW late last year; gelded since.

runners.name: Noble Horizon
runners.comment: Outpaced before keeping on in his two races at 1m; bred for this far
runners.spotlight: Kingman colt out of Irish Oaks winner Great Heavens; similar performances in both this races at 1m, having got outpaced before keeping on without threatening; this longer trip, and perhaps the softer ground, should be in his favour.

runners.name: Rogue Millions
runners.comment: They were previous winners (with penalties) he kept tabs on at Nottingham three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: 130,000gns yearling who is still in the Derby; that entry is highly optimistic after two defeats, but they were previous winners (with penalties) he kept tabs on at Nottingham three weeks ago (1m2f, good) and he's up to winning one of these.

runners.name: Sea Of Kings
runners.comment: Promising in chasing home a good horse on debut and improvement looks a formality
runners.spotlight: 250,000euros foal by Sea The Stars; made his debut in a Nottingham maiden (1m2f, good) that had no depth but he stuck to his guns from off the pace to finish clear of the remainder behind a subsequent winner (looks very promising); improvement should be a formality.

runners.name: Team Player
runners.comment: Gelded ahead of last week's debut at Chelmsford (1m) and didn't show a great deal at 22-1
runners.spotlight: Gelded ahead of last week's debut at Chelmsford (1m) and didn't show a great deal at 22-1.

runners.name: Twilight Safari
runners.comment: Seventh foal; closely related to 1m AW winner Disclosure (RPR 70)
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; closely related to 1m AW winner Disclosure (RPR 70), half-brother to winners Marmara Sea (1m6f; 84) and Beauty Angel (HK 1m1f); dam placed France 10.5f-14.5f; trainer also represented by Sea Of Kings.

runners.name: Berezka
runners.comment: Weak 20-1 chance at Ascot but kept galloping to be beaten only 3.5l; should improve
runners.spotlight: Nathaniel half-sister to two winners; weak 20-1 chance at Ascot (1m2f, good to soft) so it was an encouraging effort to go down by 3.5l and she was keeping on; respected.

runners.name: Flame Dancer
runners.comment: Half-sister to Flaming Lord (Qatari 1m/1m2f winner); hood applied for first run
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-sister to winners Flaming Lord (Qatari 1m/1m2f) and Olympic Flame (French 2m1f-2m5f chase); dam 6f/7f winner; hooded for debut and probably best watched.

runners.name: Golden Samba
runners.comment: 150-1 when always behind and tailed off over 9.4f at Wolverhampton
runners.spotlight: 150-1 when always behind and tailed off over 9.4f at Wolverhampton.

runners.name: Justcallmetreva
runners.comment: Pretty much tailed off in his two AW runs, at 1m and 7f; huge prices both times
runners.spotlight: Pretty much tailed off in her two AW runs, at 1m and 7f; huge prices both times.

runners.name: Whatamoon
runners.comment: 70,000gns yearling; will need to be quite useful to overcome her inexperience on debut
runners.spotlight: 70,000gns yearling; half-sister to five winners including Sir Delius (1m2f-1m4f; Group 3; RPR 116), Juan Elcano (7f 2yo/1m2f Listed; 115) and Nkosikazi (1m-1m2f; Group 3; 106); dam placed 1m4f AW (68); will need to be quite useful to overcome her inexperience on debut.

4:25.race_name: Dragonbet: Supporting British Racing Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
4:25.going_detailed: Straight course - GOOD, Good to soft in places; Round course - GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places

runners.name: El Matador
runners.comment: Useful form in 2 starts, still looking green when winning at Salisbury latest; big chance
runners.spotlight: Beaten at odds-on at Nottingham on his sole 2yo start (1m, soft) but that was still a good effort with the front pair clear; faced a useful opponent at Salisbury on his reappearance 26 days ago (7f, good to firm) but he was backed as though defeat was out of the question and his supporters collected, albeit after a few scares along the way; today's slower ground looks a plus and he remains capable of better.

quotes.race: Download Fitzdares New World-Class App Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: El Matador went to Nottingham and we were expecting him to win. He just got tired that day on very testing ground and he was beaten by a very decent animal in Falconer. I'm not entirely sure what the team want to do with him, but having won over seven furlongs opens up a few more possibilities because he looked like he might be a bit of a galloper last year. For him to have got the job done over what we knew would be shorter than ideal, and on quick ground, gives us a few options - Hector Crouch, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Sea Poetry
runners.comment: 7f Newmarket win on 2yo debut; ran well under a penalty on AW two weeks ago; big player
runners.spotlight: Strong form when winning a 7f fillies' novice (good to soft) at Newmarket on her sole 2yo run in November; narrowly failed to concede 7lb to another promising filly at Kempton 15 days ago and she remains capable of better; leading contender.

stable_tour.quote: She has a beautiful pedigree. Owen hasn't done a huge amount with her yet but she has the looks to be a good filly in due course. 02-08-24

runners.name: Lord Montague
runners.comment: Second to a hotpot at Salisbury (6f, good to firm) on recent debut; this looks warm again
runners.spotlight: Useful pedigree and he made a pleasing start to his career when finishing his race off well for second (no match for a good prospect) at Salisbury last week (6f, good to firm); open to plenty of improvement but there is another high bar to aim at today.

runners.name: Magnetite
runners.comment: Top-class pedigree; weakened from over 1f out on sole 2yo run; stable also run El Matador
runners.spotlight: 575,000gns yearling; by Frankel out of 1000 Guineas heroine Attraction so his pedigree is out of the top drawer; dropped away from over 1f out when the stable second string in a Newmarket novice last November (7f, good); surely capable of better this year but El Matador looks the stable's main hope.

runners.name: Maury
runners.comment: No improvement for the switch to a Class 6 handicap two weeks ago; no appeal
runners.spotlight: No improvement for the switch to a Class 6 handicap two weeks ago; no appeal.

runners.name: Reds And Wolves
runners.comment: 5th in two 7f AW runs last month, much better form on 2nd occasion; this demands even more
runners.spotlight: Finished fifth in two 7f AW runs last month, showing much better form on the second occasion; remains capable of better but such progress may coincide with a move into minor handicaps.

runners.name: Zouligan
runners.comment: Recent Newbury debut offered hope of better but he'll need a big step forward to contend
runners.spotlight: Recent Newbury debut (7f, good) wasn't devoid of promise but he will need a big step forward to trouble the principals.

runners.name: Blazing Bobcat
runners.comment: From a family the stable have enjoyed success with but probably a longer-term prospect
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; sister to 6f-1m2f winner Agapanther (RPR 66), half-sister to winners Tiger Tulip (6f AW 2yo; 82) and Medoras Childe (1m AW; 58); dam 7f/1m AW winner (73); stable have enjoyed success with the family but she's tongue tied for debut and is likely a longer-term prospect.

runners.name: Lady Monroe
runners.comment: Offered nothing in two AW runs 191 days apart, the latest last week; cheekpieces now added
runners.spotlight: Offered nothing in two AW runs 191 days apart, the latest last week; cheekpieces now added.

runners.name: Llangynin Lass

prev_owners.owner: R K & Mrs J M R Arrowsmith

runners.comment: Down the field in two runs last month (1m2f, good and 8.6f, AW); stiff task again
runners.spotlight: Down the field in two runs last month (1m2f, good and 8.6f, AW); stiff task again.

5:00.race_name: Dragonbet, Top Prices On Top Markets Handicap
5:00.going_detailed: Straight course - GOOD, Good to soft in places; Round course - GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places

runners.name: Never Dream
runners.comment: Big chance on last summer's best; ground slower than good remains a query
runners.spotlight: Made a winning handicap debut on last season's return to action at Goodwood (7f, good); ran well at Salisbury (1m, good to firm) nine days later but he ended 2024 with three lesser efforts; fresh might be the time to catch him but ground slower than good is a query.

runners.name: Clipsham La Habana
runners.comment: Tumbling down weights but failed to confirm Doncaster promise at Salisbury two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: No win since late 2022; has dropped in the weights and his reappearance effort at Doncaster wasn't a bad run but he failed to build on it at Salisbury a fortnight ago; others appeal more.

runners.name: Romanovich
runners.owner: Mrs S M Maine & Roger Gould
runners.comment: C&D winner last summer; only midfield behind Ravenglass latest; better than that
runners.spotlight: Three wins in 2024, including C&D, and he ran his best race of this campaign when a close second at Wolverhampton in March; only midfeld behind Ravenglass here 17 days ago but he's better than that.

runners.name: Ravenglass
runners.comment: Beat Too Much Trevor over C&D 17 days ago; contender despite a 4lb rise
runners.spotlight: Made a winning return to turf when getting the better of Too Much Trevor over C&D 17 days ago (good ground); 4lb higher mark to contend with but has the ability to feature.

runners.name: Roach Power
runners.comment: More encouragement dropped into a Class 6 latest; the more rain to fall the better; chance
runners.spotlight: Had a quiet 2024 for Tim Easterby and no immediate revival for this yard; more promise when third of 12 at Kempton last month, though, in his first run in a Class 6 handicap, and he now has something to build on; the more rain to fall the better for him.

stable_tour.quote: He just needed the race first time out at Doncaster and he's in good form now. He's won over seven furlongs, but he's quick and is just as good at six furlongs. 23-04-24

runners.name: Twitch
runners.breeder: P I Foreman & S A Sharrock

prev_owners.owner: Patrick Ting Siu Yin & Timothy Ting Hao Feng

runners.comment: Two AW wins last September; had an excuse when last seen; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Won twice over this trip at Chelmsford last September and he's now 2lb lower than for the second of the wins; drawn wide when failing to fire at Chelmsford on Good Friday; has his first 7f turf run for these connections and no surprise were he to give a good account.

runners.name: Kings Gem
runners.comment: Down in weights but overall profile unconvincing; best watched after a four-month break
runners.spotlight: Promise for Sir Mark Todd but he disappointed in three runs for George Boughey and he's yet to shine for current connections either; dropped a long way in the weights and may yet come good but he's apprentice-ridden after four months off and this may not be the day.

runners.name: American Rose
runners.comment: 0-8 on turf but has run well here before; not at best in two AW runs this winter
runners.spotlight: Both wins on AW but has shown promise on turf, including here; two low-key AW efforts in the winter; down to a winning mark but others look safer.

runners.name: Baynoona
runners.owner: Miss Jane Edgar & D V Gardner
runners.comment: Last two runs have seen her finish a bit closer to the target; ground a query
runners.spotlight: She hasn't offered a huge amount for this yard but her last two runs have seen her finish closer to the target and this trip could suit; something to prove on ground slower than good though.

runners.name: Marchetti
runners.comment: C&D win one year ago came after a break; feasible mark and she holds each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Infrequent winner but one of the two successes came over C&D last May on her first run after a break; has a longer absence to overcome this time but conditions will suit and she's one to consider.

runners.name: Too Much Trevor
runners.breeder: Moyns Park Estate And Stud Ltd
runners.comment: Exposed maiden but ran well for second over C&D latest, hanging left in the closing stages
runners.spotlight: Record stands at 0-15 but he ran his best race for new connections when chasing home Ravenglass over C&D 17 days ago, hanging left in the final furlong doing him no favours; up 2lb but again holds each-way claims.

stable_tour.quote: He was second on his debut at Leicester in a three-horse race, but that doesn't tell the story. He was very slowly away and lost several lengths yet still managed to run on and get second once the penny dropped. I am not saying he would have beaten the winner but he would have been much closer. 10-05-23

runners.name: Ashford Hill
runners.comment: Not built on November's shock AW win; low-key turf debut latest; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Sprung a 125-1 shock on her stable debut in November (7f, AW); the odd good run since without bettering that effort and her turf debut last month was a low-key one; others are more appealing.

runners.name: Create
runners.owner: Dixon, Wylam, M Baldry, J&S Harrod
runners.comment: Just missed out at Doncaster five weeks ago; still on a fair mark; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: She goes well at Doncaster and only just missed out in a 7f handicap there five weeks ago (front pair clear); 2lb higher as a result but she has the assistance of a promising 7lb claimer and not ruled out.

runners.name: Eye Of The Water
runners.comment: On a handy mark and conditions no problem; should build on his Bath reappearance fifth
runners.spotlight: Lurks on a dangerous mark and he should take a step forward from his reappearance effort at Bath 25 days ago; 0-10 at Chepstow but he has been placed in four of those starts.

quotes.race: Rotherby Handicap
quotes.quote: Everything went wrong for Eye Of The Water at Wolverhampton last time but, although he's won at that track, he's a much better horse on soft ground. That's the key to him - Ron Harris, trainer.

quotes.race: Molson Coors Handicap
quotes.quote: Last time Eye Of The Water ran on soft ground at Ffos Las he won. Conditions were slightly heavier today and he relished them. He was able to get a smart break and he never saw another horse after that - David Probert, jockey.

runners.name: Max Stripes
runners.comment: No progress for the switch to handicaps and looks vulnerable, even at this level
runners.spotlight: No progress for the switch to handicaps and looks vulnerable, even at this level.

2:25.going_detailed: Straight course - GOOD, Good to soft in places; Round course - GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places

runners.name: Masterofperfection
runners.comment: Beaten 16l+ in qualifying runs but bred to do better and may improve now handicapping
runners.spotlight: Beaten 16l+ in qualifying events at 1m and 1m4f but he was only 6-1 for AW reappearance (lost two shoes) and, out of a half-sister to Arc winner Marienbard, he may well improve at this level for the first time.

runners.name: Twilight Moon
runners.comment: Well held in 1m AW handicaps but bred to appreciate the step up in trip
runners.spotlight: Best effort on final 2yo start when runner-up in 1m maiden at Brighton; has not looked well treated in two AW handicaps at that distance since but she's bred to appreciate the new trip.

runners.name: Pine Cliffs
runners.comment: Won final 2yo start (1m2f, AW); modest this year; first turf run since debut
runners.spotlight: Improved for the step up to 1m2f when winning final 2yo start on AW (first-time cheekpieces); modest Tapeta form this year, however, and this will be his first turf run since soundly beaten on debut; now visored.

runners.name: Justenzia
runners.comment: Signs of ability over 1m as 2yo; better for return over 1m4f; this trip could suit better
runners.spotlight: Signs of ability, and needing further than 1m, during 2yo season but she found 1m4f and the lack of an outing against her on comeback; should come on for the run and this trip could be what's wanted; considered.

runners.name: Sol Argent
runners.owner: Family Amusements Ltd, D P Moss, S Day
runners.comment: Delivered on some 2yo promise when making all over 1m2f latest; up 5lb; may progress
runners.spotlight: Delivered on some 2yo promise when making all at Brighton (1m2f, good to firm; first-time blinkers) this month; up 5lb and has more to prove on the stamina front given the recent rain but some further progress is on the cards; yard also runs Justenzia.

runners.name: Top Of Pleinmont
runners.comment: Stiff task at 1m4f on AW before finding little on turf since; could be suited by 1m2f
runners.spotlight: Seemed to stay 1m4f when runner-up behind a wide-margin subsequent winner on AW in March but his stamina wasn't in as much evidence over that trip at Salisbury since; worth a go at 1m2f and has possibilities.

runners.name: Pomme Pomme
runners.comment: Ready winner of handicaps at 1m2f (firm) and 1m (AW); 10lb higher than latest; unexposed
runners.spotlight: Minor form to start career but she was a straightforward winner on handicap debut at Bath (1m2f, firm) and a penalty wasn't nearly enough to stop her on AW (about 1m) last week; now 10lb higher on likely the slowest ground she's raced on but good to soft ground isn't a no-no on pedigree.

runners.name: Electric Bass
runners.comment: Gave it a good shot on handicap debut (1m1f, AW); may come on again; turf debut
runners.spotlight: Improving 3yo who gave it a good shot against a short-priced favourite on AW handicap debut (1m1f) in April; lacks experience of turf but he may come on again for this stiffer test.

runners.name: Rumseg
runners.comment: Weights pull with Sol Argent on 1m2f run; 4th handicap run; others may be be less exposed
runners.spotlight: Has a weights pull with Sol Agent on recent Brighton form (1m2f, good to firm) when the run might have been needed but, now in his fourth handicap, there might be others who are less exposed off their current marks.

stable_tour.quote: He hasn't won yet but ran okay recently when third at Brighton behind Sol Argent and he might win a little race. He's entered at Chepstow on Friday. 29-05-25

runners.name: Buck Barrow
runners.comment: 0-10 but encouraging 2nd to Pomme Pomme at Bath and big turnaround in the weights
runners.spotlight: 0-10 but he made a good start for yard when chasing home Pomme Pomme at Bath (1m2f, firm) 16 days ago and a big turnaround in the weights isn't to be sniffed at with trainer continuing in fine form.

runners.name: A Bit Iffy
runners.comment: Well held in 3 runs but more interesting on handicap debut with hood fitted
runners.spotlight: Triple-figure prices and has run accordingly at 7f and 1m2f; of more interest now handicapping off a modest mark; fitting a hood may also help.

3:55.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed On dragonbet.co.uk Handicap (Chepstow Mile Series Qualifier)
3:55.going_detailed: Straight course - GOOD, Good to soft in places; Round course - GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places

runners.name: Mums Called
runners.comment: Went close over 6f on handicap debut; next run was disappointing; new trip for yard debut
runners.spotlight: Went close over 6f on AW for Paul Attwater in October (first-time blinkers) but her run over that trip for Dominic Ffrench Davis in February was disappointing; now with another new stable and tries a new trip; no headgear today; trainer has more obvious claims with Havana Club.

runners.name: Havana Club
runners.comment: Swooped from off the pace to open account at Bath this month, his 11th run; up 5lb
runners.spotlight: Swooped from off the pace to open account at Bath (1m, firm) this month, his 11th start; 5lb rise demands more from him here but he should cope with any lingering juice in the ground; respected.

runners.name: Dovey Moon
runners.comment: Claims if judged on this season's 7f AW form; below par when upped to 1m for turf return
runners.spotlight: Posted some pretty good efforts over 7f on AW in March/April but he raced too freely and was below that form when upped to 1m for recent turf return; still needs to prove he's suited by this trip-and-surface combination.

runners.name: Glentanar
runners.comment: Unexposed after only four runs but made low-key seasonal/handicap/turf debut this month
runners.spotlight: Still unexposed after only four runs but was behind Dandy Khan when making low-key seasonal/handicap/turf debut at Windsor (1m, good to firm) this month.

runners.name: Paragon
runners.comment: Third over 1m in first two handicaps; could be tough to beat if aided by cheekpieces here
runners.spotlight: Slightly disappointing when fading into third behind Havana Club at Bath (1m, firm) this month but his third of 13 on seasonal/handicap debut at Windsor (1m, good to firm) two starts ago was very encouraging and he'll be dangerous if the new cheekpieces help him to build on that effort here.

runners.name: Jack Andrea
runners.owner: J Rayment, J Stephenson & R Eddery
runners.comment: Ten-race maiden who was back in the doldrums last time; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden; kept on for very respectable fifth at Kempton (7f, AW) last month but was back in the doldrums at Windsor (1m, good to firm) on latest outing; others have more persuasive profiles.

runners.name: National Voice
runners.owner: D Macauliffe, A Don & Lds Bloodstock
runners.comment: Safely held in first two handicaps; makes turf debut after three-month break
runners.spotlight: Safely held in first two handicaps, more recently when dropped back to 7f (from 1m2f) for stable debut in February; back up to 1m for this turf debut; cheekpieces removed after one use; not the most obvious answer.

runners.name: Dandy Khan
runners.comment: Safely held on first two British starts but recent Windsor second was much better
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden; safely held on first two British starts but belied 66-1 odds when second to very progressive rival at Windsor (1m, good to firm) this month and warrants consideration here.

runners.name: Oasis Sunrise
runners.comment: Made fairly encouraging stable debut this month and might come on for the run
runners.spotlight: 0-11 for Kevin Philippart de Foy but twice went very close for him (7f/6f), and her recent stable debut behind Havana Club at Bath (1m, firm) was fairly encouraging; not out of this if that recent outing brought her on.

runners.name: Summer Rain
runners.comment: Twice in the frame over 6f on AW this spring; not sure to be suited by this new test
runners.spotlight: Seems to have learnt to settle better this spring and has made the frame on two of his last three 6f starts (both times on Tapeta); not sure to be suited by this switch back to turf or the new trip, though.

runners.name: Doctor Dauila
runners.comment: Unable to land a blow in three maidens; may fare better in low-grade handicaps
runners.spotlight: Unable to land any sort of blow in three maiden races this spring (6f/7f) but this low-grade handicap provides her with a more realistic chance to get competitive; moves up in trip; worth a glance in the betting.

runners.name: Invincible Storm
runners.comment: Second on handicap debut (7f); subsequent defeat best overlooked; makes turf debut today
runners.spotlight: Outran 33-1 odds when runner-up on seasonal/handicap debut at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) last month and almost certainly had too much use made of him over 8.6f there eight days ago; could still have potential but his tendency to race too freely remains a worry before this turf debut.

8:25.race_name: Betfred 'The Classic Bookmaker' Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Middle Distance Series) (GBBPlus)
8:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.8)

runners.name: Harpsichord
runners.comment: Could not hold a candle to winner in 3-runner Oaks Trial but this looks a reasonable mark
runners.spotlight: Won 1m4f AW novice at Lingfield last month and better form when second since in a Southwell novice (1m4f, AW) and the Lingfield Oaks Trial (11.6f, good to firm); the latter was admittedly a three-runner race and she could not hold a candle to the winner, but this looks a reasonable opening mark.

runners.name: Kurakka
runners.owner: Mrs M C Sweeney & Alan King
runners.comment: Clearcut win at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) with front two clear; promising handicap debutant
runners.spotlight: All three runs on Polytrack, improving to win 11-runner novice at Chelmsford (1m2f) on reappearance in clearcut fashion with the front two clear; turf debut asks a question but he's likely to stay and looks a promising handicap debutant.

runners.name: Best Adventure
runners.comment: Up 7lb but this trip now looks plausible after his breakthrough win at Newmarket (1m2f)
runners.spotlight: Seventh race when off the mark coming from the rear in a handicap at Newmarket (1m2f, good to firm) 13 days ago and it was an improved effort with step up in trip; up 7lb but this trip now looks plausible.

runners.name: Last Galileo
runners.comment: Put firmly in his place as 3yo in 1m1f Listed event at Newmarket and 1m4f handicap at York
runners.spotlight: Made most and won by a neck in a good scrap at Ayr (1m, good) last October in his second novice event; however, put firmly in his place this term in a Listed event at Newmarket (1m1f, good to soft) and handicap at York (1m4f, good to firm; made most) one month later; dropped 2lb.

stable_tour.quote: I think he's going to want a mile and a quarter-plus but he'll probably start off next week in the Feilden Stakes over 1m1f, which on a galloping track like Newmarket might just play to his strengths. He's quite lazy, which makes him hard to assess but I think he's got a lot of potential up to a certain level. 11-04-25

runners.name: Crackergee
runners.comment: Favourite for handicap/seasonal debut at Kempton (1m4f, AW; 6 ran) and went down by a neck
runners.spotlight: Sole turf run was debut (heavy); favourite when upped to 1m4f for handicap/seasonal debut at Kempton (AW) and duly returned an improved performance to go down by a neck in six-runner race; the winner also scored on his starts either side; up 3lb but strongly considered.

stable_tour.quote: He's a half-brother to Kyle Of Lochalsh by Cracksman. He was second last time on the all-weather at Kempton on his first run in a handicap, beaten just a neck by Scarlet Moon. He could be okay. 29-05-25

runners.name: Kuredu King
runners.comment: Ran creditably on handicap debut at Chester (1m4f, good) but it was for only 4th of seven
runners.spotlight: Reappearance fourth in a Doncaster maiden (1m2f, good to soft) suggested that 1m4f would suit and he ran creditably with cheekpieces added on handicap debut at Chester (1m4f, good) three weeks ago; the latter was good enough for only fourth of seven, however, and improvement is needed.

runners.name: Atlantic Sunset
runners.comment: Three 2nds, including latest (1m4f) when a detached last well into the penultimate furlong
runners.spotlight: Second in three of his five races, including when bouncing back in a seven-runner race at Thirsk (1m4f, good to firm) 13 days ago on handicap/turf debut; he was still a detached last well into the penultimate furlong that day before finishing with a rattle, in a steadily run race too, so needs some respect for that performance.

runners.name: Stormy Monday
runners.comment: Won well in a four-runner nursery (1m2f, soft) in October; behind at Sandown (1m2f, good)
runners.spotlight: Did not progress in maidens as 2yo but put that behind him when winning well in a four-runner nursery at Yarmouth (1m2f, soft) in October; went up 6lb and faded right out of it at Sandown (1m2f, good; 9-1) on reappearance, so has something to prove again.

runners.name: Is I Right
runners.comment: Won over C&D (good to firm) three weeks ago; up 6lb but may have turned over a new leaf
runners.spotlight: Cheekpieces for both starts this term; reappearance was encouraging and he built on that to get off the mark in seven-runner handicap over C&D (good to firm) three weeks ago, always prominent; up 6lb but may have turned over a new leaf.

runners.name: Patagonia Girl
runners.comment: Third to a hot favourite at Chester (1m4f; 28-1) on handicap/turf debut gives her a shout
runners.spotlight: Runner-up at Kempton (1m) in the second of her three AW runs last October/November; always-prominent third of seven to a hot favourite at Chester (1m4f, good; 28-1) on handicap/turf debut three weeks ago was a good start to this season and gives her a shout.

6:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.8)

runners.name: Brotherhood Of Man
runners.owner: Hm The King & Hm The Queen
runners.comment: Respected trainer has very healthy strike-rate with his 2yos here; could give good account
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam 1m AW 2yo winner (RPR 82), out of Australian 5.5f Group 1 winner; respected trainer has very healthy strike-rate with his 2yos here and this Siyouni newcomer could give a good account.

runners.name: Commanding Officer
runners.breeder: Stiftung Gestut Fahrhof U Flaxman Stable
runners.comment: 150,000euros yearling; top trainer's 2yos have been flying this season; likely player
runners.spotlight: 150,000euros yearling; third foal; Teofilo half-brother to German 1m1f winner; dam German Listed-placed 1m2f winner from useful family; top trainer won this in 2021 and 2023 and his 2yos have been flying this season; 7f could be fine at this stage of his career; likely player on debut.

runners.name: Command The Stars
runners.owner: James Paul Services To Industry Ltd
runners.comment: Dam from classy family; may want further but a market check is advised on debut
runners.spotlight: 130,000euros yearling; third foal; dam once-raced (RPR 69) half-sister to winners Eleonora Duse (1m2f Group 2) and Scottish Stage (Irish Oaks second), out of useful 1m2f winner; this Sea The Stars newcomer will probably be of greater interest over further but a market check is advised.

runners.name: Deported
runners.comment: First foal; dam 1m4f/1m6f AW winner (RPR 70); may be one for further down the line
runners.spotlight: 62,000gns yearling; first foal; dam 1m4f/1m6f AW winner (RPR 70), related to several winners, out of half-sister to 2m2f Group 2 winner Honolulu; trainer does well with 2yos and this Territories newcomer is one to watch in the betting, but he may be one for further down the line over a longer trip.

runners.name: Dodge City
runners.comment: Not devoid of promise on debut and open to improvement, but needs sizeable step forward
runners.spotlight: Not devoid of promise when 12th of 18 at 125-1 on debut at Newbury (6f, good) a fortnight ago, and he's open to improvement; however, he was behind Morris Dancer and needs a sizeable step forward today.

runners.name: Gold Dawn
runners.comment: Connections have done well with his family and he could have a big part to play on debut
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; Havana Gold half-brother to two winners in these colours, namely It Ain't Two (5f/6f 2yo including Listed) and Balon d'Or (5f including 2yo; RPR 86); dam 5f 2yo winner (85); represents last year's winning trainer and could have a big part to play on debut.

runners.name: Greybeard
runners.comment: 400,000gns yearling; from a classy family and he's firmly in calculations on debut
runners.spotlight: 400,000gns yearling; by Dark Angel; first foal; dam Listed-placed 6f 2yo winner (RPR 88), half-sister to winners Jannah Rose (French 1m2f Group 1) and Creggs Pipes (1m Group 2); firmly in calculations on debut.

runners.name: Morris Dancer
runners.comment: Encouraging run on recent debut at Newbury; in top hands and he's one to consider
runners.spotlight: 25-1 when 5l seventh of 18 on debut at Newbury (6f, good) a fortnight ago; there was promise in that performance, he's in top hands, and his pedigree suggests this extra furlong will be a plus; he's one to consider.

runners.name: On The Inlet
runners.comment: 160,000gns brother to Group 3 winner Jumby; finished last of six at Yarmouth yesterday
runners.spotlight: 160,000gns yearling with an attractive pedigree; however, he finished last of six on debut at Yarmouth (7f, good to soft; 6-1) yesterday.

runners.name: Renovatio Angel
runners.comment: Beaten a long way at 16-1 on debut at Leicester (5f, good to firm) three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to two winners who represents an in-form yard; however, beaten a long way at 16-1 on debut at Leicester (5f, good to firm) three weeks ago and a transformation is required today.

runners.name: Sweet Lord
runners.breeder: Haras De Saint Vincent, S Vidal, M Dag
runners.comment: Couldn't get into it over 5f on debut but could be a big improver now up in trip
runners.spotlight: Slowly away and couldn't get into it when ninth of 11 on last month's debut at Newbury (5f, good); however, he was sent off at just 7-2 and could be a big improver for his top trainer now up in trip.

6:05.race_name: Betfred Supports Jack Berry House Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
6:05.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.8)

runners.name: Dino Bellagio
runners.comment: Won two bumpers but came up short over hurdles; third of five in 1m4f maiden at Ripon
runners.spotlight: Won two bumpers but came up short over hurdles; third of five in maiden at Ripon (1m4f, good) six weeks ago showed significant ability in this sphere at the first attempt but he's probably still best watched for now.

quotes.race: Good Luck Beep Beep Burrow Open National Hunt Flat Race (Go North Jodami Series Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: That was good by Dino Bellagio - he'll go to Aintree - Nick Brown, owner.

stable_tour.quote: He won on his debut in an Ayr bumper before Christmas, before running down the field at Cheltenham in a Listed bumper. I ran him back last week at Doncaster and he fairly bolted up by eight lengths and the plan is to go for the Aintree bumper as he is clearly going the right way. He will be hurdling next season and has already done plenty of schooling as we considered the options of these new juvenile hurdles before deciding on the bumper route. He is one I would suggest readers keep on their side. 09-02-23

runners.name: Kabuki
runners.comment: 1-1 in bumpers and placed over hurdles; 40-1, 16l third of four in 1m3f maiden at Hamilton
runners.spotlight: 1-1 in bumpers and placed in two of his six starts over hurdles, a bit better than stablemate Dino Bellagio; 16l third of four in maiden at Hamilton (1m3f, good to firm; 40-1) two weeks ago was not such a good start under Flat rules, though.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper on his debut and then ran a nice race at Newbury, where he wasn't right. He came back and ran a nice race at Warwick, and I'd like to think he's a good bit better than his run at Sedgefield last time. He's always worked nicely. 12-11-24

runners.name: Reignman
runners.comment: Always behind on debut (9.4f, AW); 125-1 when withdrawn (upset in the stalls) in April
runners.spotlight: By a Derby winner but from a sprint family; 10-1, always behind in novice at Wolverhampton (9.4f, AW) in March; 125-1 when withdrawn (upset in the stalls) for a 1m2f Redcar novice early last month.

runners.name: Creating Mischief
runners.comment: 25-1, hampered at the start when about 15l fifth of 11 in novice at Southwell (1m4f, AW)
runners.spotlight: 25-1, hampered at the start and came from last when about 15l fifth of 11 in novice at Southwell (1m4f, AW) one month ago; capable of better but hard to fancy just yet.

runners.name: Earnest Belief
runners.comment: Debut (1m4f) did not shout short-term promise and longer trips may suit; cheekpieces go on
runners.spotlight: 110,000gns yearling; brother to very smart stayer Coltrane; 8-1, needed some riding when never-dangerous fourth of six in maiden at Salisbury (1m4f, good to firm) early this month; that did not shout short-term promise and longer trips may prove his forte, but cheekpieces are enlisted and he has a place chance.

runners.name: Pole Star
runners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Al Maktoum
runners.comment: He sets the standard judged on both runs (1m4f, turf) and still has potential
runners.spotlight: 2l fourth of six was a bright debut at Chester (1m4f, good) despite evident inexperience and he battled his way to go down by a head in novice at Newmarket (1m4f, good to firm) eight days later; he sets the standard judged on both runs and still has potential.

runners.name: Valiancy
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: 410,000gns yearling; hopefully more clued up now and this is not as strong as Newbury race
runners.spotlight: 410,000gns yearling by Cracksman; half-brother to 5.7f/6f winner Givemethebeatboys (including Group 3; RPR 112) out of 1m3f/1m4f winner (84); weak 14-1 for maiden at Newbury (1m2f, good) two weeks ago, slowly away and pushed along almost throughout but he made a little headway to be seventh of ten; he will hopefully be more clued up now and this race is not as strong.

runners.name: Warrior King
runners.owner: O T I Racing, Paul Inglett & Partner
runners.comment: 28-1, always mid-division at Kempton (1m2f, AW); should improve but needs to in a big way
runners.spotlight: 28-1, always mid-division in novice at Kempton (1m2f, AW) last month; should improve but needs to in a big way.

runners.name: Louies Folly
runners.comment: Well-related Nathaniel filly but beaten 22l in a novice at Kempton (1m4f, AW; 16-1)
runners.spotlight: Well-related Nathaniel filly but beaten 22l in a never-dangerous sixth of nine for novice at Kempton (1m4f, AW; 16-1) over three weeks ago.

runners.name: Simply Ruby
runners.comment: Fair form at Lingfield (1m4f, AW) and Salisbury (1m2f, good to firm); firmly in picture
runners.spotlight: Never dangerous in a maiden at Lingfield (1m4f, AW) or novice at Salisbury (1m2f, good to firm) but she showed fair form in both, which puts her firmly in the each-way picture.

5:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.8)

runners.name: Saligo Bay

prev_owners.owner: Ballylinch Stud, P Inglett & N Jones

runners.comment: Chelmsford win (1m2f, AW) eight days ago in tidy style under Eireann Cagney; 4lb penalty
runners.spotlight: 1m4f turf and hurdles winner for previous yards; broke the ice for current trainer in amateurs' handicap at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) eight days ago in tidy style under Eireann Cagney; major player under 4lb penalty.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: This is a better track for Saligo Bay than Chester and he deserved a win, although he wants a bit of dig in the ground. He'd stay further, but I think we'll stay at a mile and a half and hopefully he'll improve and win another, while I think he's the type who would do well hurdling - Roger Charlton, trainer.

runners.name: The Dancing Poet
runners.comment: Good record at Catterick; well beaten at other tracks this term; back to last winning mark
runners.spotlight: The last three of his ten wins were last May-September (two over 1m4f then one at 1m6f) and he's 6-18 at Catterick, unraced here since two placed efforts in 2020; well beaten at three other tracks this term but he's now back to his last winning mark.

quotes.race: National Racehorse Week Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: He's fantastic, he loves it round here. This is his level; perfect. The Dancing Poet is nine years old now but he seems to be getting better with age - Matt Brown, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: weatherbysshop.co.uk Handicap
quotes.quote: The Dancing Poet is a big galloping horse but he likes sharp tracks. He's one-paced but he felt unreal today. He quickened up really well off a steady pace. I was always in the driving seat to kick on and he won nicely in the end - Ben Robinson, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Animato
runners.comment: Two 2m wins last May and some echoes of that; left David O'Meara for 8,000gns last October
runners.spotlight: 2m wins at Catterick (good) and Chester (good to soft) last May and some echoes of that afterwards before leaving David O'Meara for 8,000gns last October; makes yard debut, with cheekpieces returning instead of his usual visor; well treated if back to the form of this time last year.

quotes.race: Net World Sports 15th Anniversary Handicap
quotes.quote: Animato has his quirks but did it well the last day. I'd have liked to be handier today but he's got the talent and they went an honest gallop - Jason Watson, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Tokyo Bay
runners.comment: Yet to make a serious impact in handicaps; sinking in weights; sixth at Ripon Thursday
runners.spotlight: Won maiden at Ripon (1m4f, heavy) in April 2024; has not made a serious impact in any of his six handicaps but sinking in the weights and stuck to his task for sixth of ten when prominent in the betting at Ripon (1m4f) yesterday.

runners.name: Ribble River
runners.comment: On the up in 2024; creditable 3rd at Pontefract (1m4f) on return and could resume progress
runners.spotlight: Progressive as he went up in trip in handicaps last year, winning at Carlisle (1m3f, good) and Hamilton (1m4f, good to soft) on last two starts; creditable third at Pontefract (1m4f) on return and could resume progress.

runners.name: Warning Sign
runners.breeder: S A R L Ecurie Jean Louis Bouchard
runners.comment: Disappointing favourite on return (1m) two months ago but no shock if he bounces back
runners.spotlight: Runner-up four times in successive 7f-1m4f handicaps under David Dunsdon last year; disappointing favourite on reappearance (1m) two months ago but no shock if he bounces back and he's on a good mark.

runners.name: Brunello Breeze
runners.comment: The last time he finished better than fifth in a turf race was back in August 2022
runners.spotlight: Won twice on AW early in 2024 but ended that campaign out of form and the last time he finished better than fifth in a turf race was back in August 2022; cheekpieces return instead of his usual blinkers.

runners.name: Unplugged
runners.comment: Last won July 2023; thrown in judged on his placed form on turf in three runs last summer
