stable_tour.quote: We're still learning about him. He's quite big and probably didn't handle Musselburgh that well and was a little bit unlucky as he got a bump at the wrong time. He got closer at Doncaster when second on Saturday when he ducked right when challenging. Hopefully he'll be a player in a similar race soon. 07-05-25

runners.name: Orangesandlemons
runners.comment: Off the mark at fifth attempt in an AW novice; not thrown in here but may improve again
runners.spotlight: Sent off favourite for four of her five races and finally delivered when ridden out in a 1m AW novice at Southwell; doesn't look that well handicapped on the bare form and has been confined to Tapeta thus far; still needs respecting with her consistent profile.

runners.name: Crest Of Light
runners.comment: If as good on turf then he should be bang there despite his rising mark
runners.spotlight: All eight races on the AW and gained second career win in first-time cheekpieces at Wolverhampton (8.6f) a month ago; has been consistent in handicaps and if as good on turf then he should be bang there despite his rising mark.

runners.name: Cymbidium
runners.comment: Hit and miss since her successful nursery debut at Thirsk (1m, good) last September
runners.spotlight: Hit and miss since her successful nursery debut at Thirsk (1m, good) last September; wouldn't be the most reliable option.

stable_tour.quote: She's the first yearling we've bought who has managed to win, although we've had only a handful. It was a sweet success at Thirsk having gone on that journey with her. She showed a really good attitude and appreciated being stepped up to a mile. She ran well at Ayr last week over 7f but she wants to go back up to a mile. She's a well-bred filly from the family of Study Of Man. She's not a big filly but she stays really well and has a good attitude. She'll stay further than a mile and there should be more improvement from her. 26-09-24

runners.name: Sherlock
runners.comment: 0-8 but only collared late in the day at Doncaster (7f, good/firm), albeit in a Class 6
runners.spotlight: 0-8 but was only collared late in the day at Doncaster (7f, good to firm), albeit in Class 6; doesn't look that progressive and he's inconsistent

1:45.race_name: Quooker 100 Degrees Apprentice Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Stayers Series Qualifier)
1:45.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places (GoingStick: 5.6)

runners.name: Time Tells All
runners.comment: In a fair run of form right now and should go well now into a Class 6 for the first time
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden who hasn't been disgraced in any of his last four races and went very close the once; goes on all ground and should go well now into a Class 6 for the first time.

runners.name: Ebony Maw

prev_owners.owner: B Jordan, Brian Jordan, S Jordan & N McConnell

runners.comment: Five-time turf winner on good or slower ground; recent AW run was after a break
runners.spotlight: Five-time turf winner at up to 2m on good or slower ground; on a competitive mark and recent Newcastle run, when last of four but not beaten far, was after a break.

quotes.race: Metges Lane Maiden
quotes.quote: Ebony Maw did that lovely. He's still green, he dosn't have many miles on the clock, and he wouldn't want the ground any better than yielding. There could be a nice handicap in him over 1m2f plus - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer

runners.name: Arctic Fox

prev_owners.owner: Colin Taylor And Miss Kay Wilding

runners.comment: Regressive profile under both codes and was beaten a long way at Catterick 18 days ago
runners.spotlight: A 9yo with a regressive profile under both codes and was beaten a long way at Catterick 18 days ago.

quotes.race: Queen Mother's Cup Handicap (For Lady Amateur Riders)
quotes.quote: It's the right time of year for the three-year-olds taking on the older horses. Arctic Fox has won three in a row and the step up in trip has not bothered her - Richard Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Reel Her In
runners.comment: Positives to take out of last two races, the latest panning out none too favourably
runners.spotlight: Both wins came at Musselburgh last October, staying races on good and good to soft; positives to take out of last two outings, the latest back at Musselburgh panning out none too favourably.

runners.name: Corsican Caper
runners.comment: Won at Chester (2m) last September off 10lb higher; enjoys some give underfoot
runners.spotlight: Won at Chester (2m) last September off 10lb higher; enjoys some give underfoot and conditions were quick when fourth at Nottingham two runs back; latest AW run respectable as rarely shines on the AW; chance.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Corsican Caper loves this type of ground, so he'll probably keep going through the autumn. He's not hard on himself and hopefully there's a bit of improvement in him. He'll cope with a bigger track as well and anything from a mile-six to two miles will suit him - Kevin Frost, trainer.

runners.name: Bollin Neil
runners.comment: Returns to the Flat on the back of competitive runs over hurdles (winning once)
runners.spotlight: Returns to the Flat on the back of competitive runs over hurdles (winning once); long time since he had his head in front on the Flat but in current form, and off this low a mark, he needs respecting; recent rain will be helpful.

runners.name: Elvington
runners.comment: No better on handicap debut when upped to 1m6f on the AW; lots to prove
runners.spotlight: Looked limited in maiden/novice races and no better on handicap debut when upped to 1m6f on the AW; lots to prove.

runners.name: Aighear
runners.comment: Well beaten at Ayr after a long layoff; questionable what ability she retains
runners.spotlight: Every chance on plenty of good runs in 2023 but was well beaten at Ayr after a long layoff; questionable what ability she retains.

3:45.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places (GoingStick: 5.6)

runners.name: Cascade Hall
runners.comment: Very lightly raced 6yo; yet to win but went close at Ayr two runs ago; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: 6yo who is 0-8 (0-5 on the Flat); close second of four when upped to 1m7f at Ayr two runs ago, then couldn't get into it when fifth of nine over 2m at Catterick last time; drops back in distance today but at a stiff track and trainer's horses are often versatile trip-wise; not ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: I struggle to buy horses at the horses-in-training sales, but I bought him off Tom Malone. He ran well when second at Ayr last Thursday when just denied by a head. We're not sure about his trip as he was a hurdler we bought but we've handicapped him. We think he's a nice horse and I'll be disappointed if we don't win a few races with him, but I might have bought a hurdler. He's got ability and it's just finding the right trip for him. 07-05-25

runners.name: Selwan
runners.comment: Regressive last year and soundly beaten on his recent stable/seasonal debut at Doncaster
runners.spotlight: His mark continues to tumble but he was regressive for Ian Williams last year and soundly beaten on his recent stable/seasonal debut at Doncaster.

stable_tour.quote: He had issues with his feet when he arrived from France. We thought we'd 10-11-23

runners.name: Dibble Dabble
runners.comment: Runner-up on two of her three starts this year and she's a leading player today
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on two of her three starts this year, most recently at Windsor (11.4f, good to firm) last month; won on good to soft ground last June (also effective on heavy); she's a leading player today.

runners.name: Wadacre Giorgio
runners.comment: 11-1 when withdrawn on recent handicap/seasonal debut (bolted); bred to win races
runners.spotlight: Mixed form last autumn across his first three starts (1m-10.3f); gelded subsequently and withdrawn from last Saturday's comeback at Beverley having bolted before the start (11-1 at the time); this lightly raced 4yo is bred to win races and is not discounted on handicap debut.

runners.name: Solar Bentley
runners.comment: Could show the benefit of his reappearance outing, especially if slow ground prevails
runners.spotlight: Just one win from his 15 starts but that came at Ffos Las (1m2f, heavy) last August and he didn't run badly on recent reappearance at Newcastle; could show the benefit of that outing today, especially if slow ground prevails; first-time blinkers replace cheekpieces.

runners.name: Idyllic
runners.comment: On a competitive mark on last season's AW form but she didn't shine on sole run on turf
runners.spotlight: On a competitive mark on last season's 1m2f AW form for Charlie Fellowes, and she could improve for her recent stable debut outing at Newcastle; however, she didn't shine last September on her sole run on turf.

runners.name: Educate
runners.comment: 1m4f AW win last month; this return to turf poses a question but he's entitled to respect
runners.spotlight: Ended a losing sequence in a reapplied tongue-tie (retained) at Wolverhampton (1m4f, AW) last month; this return to turf poses a question but he's entitled to respect having gone back up just 2lb for last time.

runners.name: Redondo
runners.comment: Below last winning mark but he was struggling when last seen and stamina is a major doubt
runners.spotlight: He's 2lb lower than when winning at Hamilton (1m1f, good) last May and has won after a break in the past; one to watch in the betting on reappearance but he was struggling when last seen and stamina is a major doubt.

runners.name: Toronto Raptor
runners.comment: Tailed off at 33-1 on stable debut but on good ground; a slow surface could help today
runners.spotlight: Below par last year on final three runs for Michael Bell and tailed off at 33-1 on stable/seasonal debut at Beverley; however, perhaps the good ground didn't suit and he's 8lb lower than when runner-up at Pontefract (1m4f, soft) last July; a slow surface could help and he's not a forlorn hope.

runners.name: Game Management
runners.owner: Mrs C Clark, Ellerby, Pollitt & Quinlan
runners.comment: Ran well over hurdles late last year; could have untapped potential at this trip on Flat
runners.spotlight: Won at Newcastle (1m, AW) last September for Kevin Ryan and ran well over hurdles late last year on first two runs for this yard; could have untapped potential at this sort of trip now back on the Flat; interesting.

runners.name: Budding
runners.breeder: Macha B/Stock / Meridian Int / N Drion

prev_owners.owner: P C J Dalby & R D Schuster

runners.comment: Tailed off on stable debut in December and 0-10, but on a good mark and not written off
runners.spotlight: Made it 0-10 when tailed off on stable debut at Newcastle last December, and off since; however, she's well treated on last year's best form for Hughie Morrison and shouldn't be written off back from a break.

stable_tour.quote: She's an all right little filly who should be competitive off her current handicap mark. She nearly won at Windsor the run before last. She didn't enjoy the track at Chepstow last week - she's better than that. 06-06-24

runners.name: Haafapenny
runners.owner: Mrs P A Johnson & C H Stephenson
runners.comment: Very lightly raced but tailed off at 33-1 on handicap/seasonal debut at Beverley
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who should be capable of better than she showed on this month's handicap/seasonal debut at Beverley (1m4f, good to firm), but she was tailed off at 33-1 and it's hard to be confident on the back of that.

runners.name: Hot Team
runners.owner: Pat Morris And Clear Cut Racing
runners.comment: The return to turf could be a plus and he has same mark as for easy win in this last year
runners.spotlight: 9yo who hasn't shone on AW on his last four starts but has a much better strike-rate on turf and runs off the same mark as for his easy win in this race 12 months ago (soft); won on good ground last June; one to consider.

quotes.race: Norfolk Park Norfolk Novice Median Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: I'm very pleased Hot Team as got his head in front as I thought he slightly threw it away at York last time. James was happy enough with him on ground that was quick enough. We very nearly didn't run and I think a lot of Zoffanys like a bit of cut in the ground. We'll probably wait now until we get soft in the going description or get genuinely good ground. He's got a handicap mark, but he could run in a novice with a penalty, or he could run in any race, including, if it got soft, the Acomb. I think he is smart enough and I think he'll be better in a better class of race. He travelled in his race at York and there like nothing would get near him and it's almost like he needs something to take him into the race. I think he's better than he's rated now, but on softer ground he could improve - Hugo Palmer, trainer.

4:50.race_name: Andersons - Serving The Community Since 1888 Handicap (Div I)
4:50.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places (GoingStick: 5.6)

runners.name: Blufferonthebus
runners.comment: Not been pulling up any trees on the AW but returning to turf should suit
runners.spotlight: Has gone 0-10 since winning on soft at Beverley last summer (7f), though suffered two near misses during that sequence; returning to turf should suit; useful mark as well.

runners.name: Highfield Viking
runners.comment: Would have plenty in his favour if in good form for this belated return
runners.spotlight: Both handicap wins have been on slow ground, over 6f and 7f; consistent in his final four outings of last year and would have plenty in his favour if in good form for this belated return.

stable_tour.quote: He's a half-brother to Highfield Princess, who improved from three to four and beyond, and I'd like to think he'll improve further and make up into a solid handicapper. He's by Aclaim and we've found his progeny act with a bit of juice in the ground. We tried him visored on his last run as he can race lazily in the middle of a race and I'd have thought we'll continue that unless he sharpens up. 20-03-24

runners.name: Saisons Dor
runners.comment: Made a lot of the running at Southwell; only raised 2lb and he can hold his form
runners.spotlight: Had a wide trip at Catterick two runs back but ran well the time before and made a lot of the running to win last time at Southwell (7f); can hold his form and has only been raised 2lb.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: We were expecting a good run but were worried about the draw and the rain-softened ground. Saisons D'Or has proved his versatility and it opens up more options - Jedd O'Keeffe, trainer.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Saisons D'Or battled well to the line. He's a consistent horse and the mile suited him well here. He was a bit gassy as a youngster but settles much better now and that enables him to stay this trip - Jack Garritty, jockey.

runners.name: Original Thinker
runners.comment: Struggled badly in two runs in the autumn following a break; now returns from another
runners.spotlight: Won over a bit further at Beverley 12 months ago (good to soft) but struggled badly in two runs in the autumn following a break; now returns from another.

quotes.race: Celebrating 50 Years Of Humberside Airport Handicap
quotes.quote: Original Thinker has always shown a lot at home and she was second at Newcastle off a higher mark. She was dropped 2lb the other day for her run at Doncaster, so she was about right - Harriet Bethell, trainer.

runners.name: Golden Goose
runners.comment: Well-backed winner at Southwell in March, which represented improvement; up 5lb
runners.spotlight: Quiet in five Irish runs (including two handicaps) but returned from a break at Southwell in March (7f), went off the 5-4 favourite and duly delivered from off the pace; had 90 days off but clearly able when fresh and should be fine on turf; raised 5lb.

runners.name: Braes Of Doune
runners.comment: Usually gives his running and, back at 7f with rain about, he can't be ruled out
runners.spotlight: Versatile trip-wise; held up and was never getting there when fifth of the seven runners at Hamilton two weeks ago (1m1f); usually gives his running and, back at 7f with rain about, he can't be ruled out.

runners.name: Naval Academy
runners.comment: Well handicapped and a step back in the right direction when fifth at Leicester
runners.spotlight: Now 10lb lower than when winning over Haydock's 7f last July and took a step back in the right direction when fifth at Leicester (7f, good to firm) latest; he has soft-ground form if going back far enough.

runners.name: Bowman
runners.comment: Might be about to turn a corner but probably wants the ground good or quicker on turf
runners.spotlight: Has come down the weights and didn't get the clearest of runs when backed last week at Wolverhampton (7f); might be about to turn a corner but probably wants the ground good or quicker on turf.

quotes.race: Cazoo Derby Festival Handicap
quotes.quote: I wanted to get a breather in going down to the road and from there we just stepped up while trying to save a bit for the end. I thought it was a good run and Bowman likes to make the running, but you have to get going on him before they start challenging him as then he can battle back. He had good bits of form before they got him and he ran well last time, so he was not without a chance - William Carson, rider.

quotes.race: Watch Racing TV Novice Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: Bowman was better today and it is nice that he has improved on that first run - Franny Norton, jockey.

runners.name: Angel Of The Bay
runners.comment: Caught the eye once or twice last season but ultimately disappointing
runners.spotlight: Caught the eye once or twice last season but ultimately disappointing and remains a maiden after a quiet run in January.

2:45.race_name: Andersons - Quality For The Home Handicap
2:45.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places (GoingStick: 5.6)

runners.name: Milbanke

prev_owners.owner: L C And A E Sigsworth

runners.comment: Has beaten one rival in three starts this year and blinkers clearly need to do something
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner but has beaten one rival in three starts this year and blinkers clearly need to do something.

runners.name: Classy Al
runners.comment: Not easy to win with but well handicapped and last week's Ayr run was more like it
runners.spotlight: Not easy to win with but well handicapped and last week's Ayr run was more like it (5f, good to firm); might be on the way back and handles give underfoot.

stable_tour.quote: He's a bairn I know well as I trained his dam and granny, but he hasn't been easy to train. First time out this year he dropped Paul Mulrennan going to the start but, despite his quirks, he has an engine. I have an idea to run him on the all-weather to change the script a little. He's in grand form at home and we'll look at the 5f and 7f handicaps next week at Ayr. 12-09-22

runners.name: Runninwild
runners.comment: Two 6f wins here last summer but hasn't looked with it in his two runs this season
runners.spotlight: Secured back-to-back wins over 6f here last summer but hasn't looked with it in his two runs this season.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Handicap
quotes.quote: Runninwild can usually be a bit buzzy so he's settled well here despite being in the stalls for a long time. I never intended to make the running but in fairness when every horse came to challenge him he just kept finding and he's toughed it out well - Shane Gray, jockey.

runners.name: Sergeant Mayer
runners.comment: Has won his last two and escapes a penalty for the latest win at Ripon
runners.spotlight: Consistent sprinter who has won his last two and escapes a penalty for the latest win at Ripon (5f, good; kept on to score narrowly); his improvement has come on dry ground so might not appreciate too much rain, though can handle good to soft; up 4lb in future.

runners.name: Lady Celia

prev_owners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd

runners.comment: Quiet return but she's capable on her day and is a C&D winner with cut underfoot
runners.spotlight: Better at 5f than the 6f she ran over on AW reappearance but she did finish last and could have run better; that leaves her with a bit to prove, though she's capable on her day and is a C&D winner with cut underfoot.

quotes.race: Hampton By Hilton Hamilton Park Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Lady Celia loves it here but the key to her is the ground and Archie [Young] gave her a marvellous ride. She's also won over six furlongs and on all-weather and she's thriving at the moment - Alan Brown, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Mattice
runners.owner: C Ward, B Kirby & B Valentine
runners.comment: Four-time winner but stuck on a losing run and well down the field this season
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner but stuck on a losing run and well down the field this season, in cheekpieces and blinkers.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Ayr Bronze Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Mattice is only a three-year-old and there could be some good days for him in the future - Tim Easterby, trainer.

runners.name: Canons House
runners.owner: M Mchale And J Munroe Racing
runners.comment: Maiden/novice efforts were encouraging but never progressed at all in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Maiden/novice efforts were encouraging but never progressed at all in handicaps; could yet come good but reservations after a break.

runners.name: Papa Cocktail
runners.comment: 3lb well in after narrow defeat at Redcar; the recent rain won't have helped him
runners.spotlight: No joy since securing a hat-trick in 2023 but nearly put that right when going down in a bobbing finish at Redcar (6f, good to firm); returns to 5f on a stiff track and he's 3lb well in, but the recent rain won't have helped him.

stable_tour.quote: I think he is a very nice colt with a bright future. His work had been encouraging this spring and we started him off over 7f late last month at Yarmouth in what looked a particularly hot maiden, with several of the big yards represented and many trainers liking their charges. He ran a cracker to be third behind New Science, where he was rather green but ran on well. It was the perfect start to his career as he will have learned plenty and mentally handled things well. There are a few 7f maidens around Royal Ascot time later this month and we will pick our spot to make him a winner and take it from there. He runs in the colours of owner Khalifa Dasmal, who is a great man to train for. His patronage is largely thanks to my former guv'nor David Simcock giving him a nod in my direction. David has been a huge help to me in my career and I am very hopeful that I have a potentially nice horse here for Mr Dasmal. 10-06-21

runners.name: Happier
runners.comment: Not at her best this year and another tweak in the headgear is tried
runners.spotlight: Not at her best this year and the reapplied blinkers didn't do much for her when tried once before, albeit without the tongue-tie; others safer.

runners.name: Jack Of Clubs
runners.comment: Won't be inconvenienced by the recent rain and ran well on last season's reappearance
runners.spotlight: Exposed 5yo with a strike-rate of 2-24; has an up-and-down profile but won't be inconvenienced by the recent rain and ran well on last season's reappearance.

quotes.race: Malcolm Greenslade Doncaster LVA Stalwart Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Jack of Clubs was going six furlongs and he was unrideable, he was too keen. He ran well over five at Musselburgh last time and we were just waiting for the right race and cut in the ground. He's a lot easier for the jockeys to ride over five because the pace of the race helps them, over six he gets in behind and he's climbing. Hopefully he can win again at five - Michael Dods, trainer.

runners.name: Ski Angel
runners.comment: On a losing run but comeback effort was encouraging and had an excuse last time
runners.spotlight: Won two of her first three races last season but hasn't been able to win again despite becoming well handicapped; however, wasn't beaten far in her comeback race and when 2-1 at Ayr a month ago she reportedly fly-leapt on exiting the stalls.

stable_tour.quote: The owners have been very patient as they bought her as a yearling. She went to John Quinn but never raced as a two-year-old. She ran three times as a three-year-old without winning and the owners brought her here along with Bloomin Robbery. She's now won three times for us, including at Ayr last time out. She's gone up 5lb for that to 53, but the way she won you'd like to think she's got a bit more in hand and I see her as a high 50s or low 60s horse. She was ridden last time by Duran Fentiman,  who rides for Tim Easterby. He's an underrated jockey - very strong and capable. 16-05-24

3:15.race_name: Andersons - Cumbria's Premier Decking Specialist Handicap
3:15.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places (GoingStick: 5.6)

runners.name: Mile By Mile
runners.comment: Closed out last season with a second to a well-treated winner; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to dual heavy-ground winner Hour By Hour who closed out last season with a second to a well-treated winner on her nursery debut (Tapeta); one to consider off the same mark.

runners.name: Miss Raincloud
runners.comment: Well related but seemingly exposed as ordinary, finishing well beaten all starts (7f-1m2f)
runners.spotlight: Well related but seemingly exposed as ordinary, finishing well beaten all starts (7f-1m2f), including off this mark on her handicap debut here early last week.

stable_tour.quote: She works really well at home and should go well. She needs 7f to a mile. She had her first run in a handicap at Carlisle on Monday. She's a lovely filly and a half-sister to the Britannia winner Khaloosy, but she was a May foal and is still a little bit weak. She's my dark horse. 21-05-25

runners.name: Miss Cast
runners.comment: Often pulled hard; had plenty of chances now and isn't obviously fancied
runners.spotlight: Pulled hard on her first two runs back but then lacked the pace for 5f last Monday; had plenty of chances now and isn't obviously fancied.

runners.name: Sharon Curly
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.comment: Not beaten far in a busy finish at Redcar last Monday; today's stiff 6f should be fine
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far in a busy finish at Redcar last Monday; that came from the front over 7f and today's stiff 6f should be fine, with Ethan Tindall (3-52 for the yard) taking off 7lb.

runners.name: Love Games
runners.comment: Can pull hard and is exposed now; holds claims on a few of his handicap efforts though
runners.spotlight: Inclined to pull hard a couple of times when returning from breaks and is exposed now; holds claims on a few of his handicap efforts, though, including last autumn's C&D third.

runners.name: Sanbona
runners.comment: Three solid runs since sprinting in a visor; easing of the ground a possible concern
runners.spotlight: Might have got away better from a handy draw at Ripon 12 days ago but that was another decent effort to back up two solid runs from wider stalls since sprinting in a visor; significant easing of the ground would be a possible concern on pedigree.

runners.name: Pastoral Way
runners.breeder: J A Knox And Mrs M A Knox
runners.comment: Seemed fine with this trip for the first time at Ripon but had plenty of chances now
runners.spotlight: Seemed fine with this trip for the first time at Ripon three weeks ago (first-time cheekpieces; switches to a visor today) when handicapped by his jockey dropping his whip; had plenty of chances, though, and has been expensive to follow.

runners.name: Promise Time
runners.comment: Will be 3lb higher from tomorrow and is drawn to attack again, so will rightly be popular
runners.spotlight: Pulled hard when nabbed late on his handicap debut (7f, Tapeta) and again down to 6f at Wolverhampton last week (both from the front); due to go up 3lb tomorrow and is drawn to attack again, so will rightly be popular.

runners.name: Inertia
runners.comment: Needs to settle better upped from 5f round here; Connor Beasley rides stablemate Sanbona
runners.spotlight: Invariably pulled away his chances last year and was gelded over the winter; no surprise to see a hood tried on his comeback, but it didn't help and he'll need to settle better upped from 5f round this stiff course; Connor Beasley rides stablemate Sanbona.

runners.name: Nave Force
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs C Booth & Mrs S Cammidge
runners.comment: Only run on Tapeta to date and has achieved little; trainer best known for older horses
runners.spotlight: Only run on Tapeta to date and has achieved little, including in a hood (off today) when last seen ten weeks ago; trainer, who also saddles Jackchester, is best known for older horses and boasts an ordinary record with 3yos in recent times.

runners.name: Jackchester
runners.comment: Having a first crack at sprinting in first-time headgear and is hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: Three poor efforts at huge prices thus far; having a first crack at sprinting in first-time headgear and is hard to make a case for.

runners.name: Freak Encounter
runners.comment: Fair debut for his new yard from the front over 7.8f here latest; this more about speed
runners.spotlight: Did most racing for Jamie Osborne, from whom he was picked up for 3,000gns, over further; fair debut for his new yard from the front, without the usual blinkers, over 7.8f here latest but this will be more about speed.

5:20.race_name: Andersons - Serving The Community Since 1888 Handicap (Div II)
5:20.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places (GoingStick: 5.6)

runners.name: Homer Stokes
runners.comment: All 3 turf wins over 7f at Catterick; near winning mark; needs to prove suited by stiff 7f
runners.spotlight: All three turf wins at Catterick, over 7f on soft; just 1lb higher than the latest of them in October and he has won following a break but he needs to prove suited by a thorough test at 7f.

runners.name: Rwenearlytheredad
runners.breeder: Fernham Farm Ltd & Mr E Cantillon
runners.comment: Slow start to 2024 but ended the year with 7f and 1m wins on soft; may yet do better
runners.spotlight: Has won on a variety of tracks; had a slow start to 2024 but he went out with a bang in the autumn, winning at Catterick (7f) and Redcar (1m; both on soft); back on a career-high mark, which shouldn't be beyond him, but there could be more to come this year; tongue-tie fitted.

quotes.race: Start Your RacingTV Free Trial Now Handicap
quotes.quote: Freddy Tylicki bought Rwenearlytheredad and Declan [Carroll, trainer]'s always thought a lot of him. I said to Declan to sell him in February but I might change my mind. I think he could put up a sequence now - John Blackburn, owner, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Stipulation
runners.comment: Easy to back in all 3 handicaps at 1m and 1m2f; a stiff 7f is well worth investigating
runners.spotlight: Easy to back in all three handicaps, doing best in the first of them (about 1m on AW) before having something to prove upped to 1m2f on two subsequent starts; a thorough test at 7f looks well worth investigating and it's still early days.

runners.name: Enpassant
runners.comment: 7f turf winner last June; won on AW since but form tailed off; well treated for new yard
runners.spotlight: Won over 7f at Leicester (good to soft) last June off 9lb higher; kept busy on AW over the winter for Stuart Williams, winning at Kempton (7f) in February, but his form tailed off, including back on turf in April; sold for 7,000gns since; goes without usual aids for new trainer.

runners.name: Spirit Of Bowland
runners.comment: Fourth AW win in April; up 10lb; first turf run since 2022 so big query about the surface
runners.spotlight: Gained fourth AW win on second start after an absence (1m) in April but the extra distance (about 1m1f) didn't play out so well off 10lb higher at Wolverhampton since; well beaten in sole turf handicap in 2022 and unraced on grass since so needs to show he can handle it.

runners.name: Front Gunner

prev_owners.owner: Ms J Bianco, D Barker, G Wood

runners.comment: Won on AW (7f) in October; lesser turf runs previously but fared better when third latest
runners.spotlight: Never headed when off the mark on Newcastle AW (7f) in October; lesser efforts on turf previously, including over C&D, but his recent Catterick third of 13 (good to firm) was more encouraging; can benefit from the run and prove more of a factor on turf this year.

runners.name: Drafted
runners.comment: Broke duck over 7f on AW in November; 0-11 on turf and needs to prove suited by stiff 7f
runners.spotlight: Broke duck over 7f on AW in November and has recaptured some form in refitted cheekpieces on last two starts; quite well treated on past turf form at this trip but he never threatened on grass in 2024 and needs to prove that a stiff 7f suits.

runners.name: The Gay Blade
runners.comment: Turf winner at 7f; similar chance to Drafted on AW form and can have a say in an open race
runners.spotlight: Turf winner at 7f and similar chance to Drafted on 7f AW form in November; returned from a short break with a good run on Tapeta last month and has course form at 6f so can have a say in an open race.

quotes.race: Watch On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: The Gay Blade is not a bad little horse at his level. He likes it around the likes of Hamilton and Musselburgh and is pretty consistent - Iain Jardine, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a good horse for our racing club and gives everybody a lot of fun. He has his level but you can set your clock by him when he's in his grade. He seems to like Hamilton and he battled on gamely to dead-heat there last week - he got carried over the track and I think he ought to have been given the race. Although he handles an all-weather surface he's more effective on slow ground on turf. He could do well on wet ground at the back end. 26-07-24

runners.name: Purple Martini
runners.owner: D Shapiro, D Clifford, Blue Lion Rcg Ix
runners.comment: Just 1lb higher than successful return at Musselburgh and recent rain won't be a problem
runners.spotlight: Made the most of a useful mark when winning on Musselburgh return (7f, good; has won on soft) in April; has to prove as well suited by a stiffer test at the trip but she's still well treated after going back up just 1lb and the recent rain will not be a problem.

4:55.race_name: BoyleSports Money Back If 2nd To SP Fav Handicap
4:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places

runners.name: Asdana
runners.breeder: Lynch Bages Ltd & Edge Ridge Ltd
runners.comment: Promise in maidens last year, no show when last on handicap debut on return, visor returns
runners.spotlight: Promise in last two 6f maiden runs in 2024 at the Curragh and Navan on yielding-soft; last of 17 on return at Naas (6f, gd-yld); visor returns (worn for good run at Navan); nicely drawn but would have liked to have seen more last time out.

runners.name: Billie Be Quick
runners.comment: C&D nursery winner, 1lb lower now, well-drawn, return to this venue could spark revival
runners.spotlight: Won a nursery over C&D (yielding) from wide draw on her final run of 2024; no show in two runs this season but is now 1lb below that course success; well-drawn and return to this venue could spark a revival.

runners.name: Mini Mai
runners.comment: H'cap debutante, yard in form, this track might suit, worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante from in-form yard; minor promise in maidens but weakened quickly at Navan (5f, latest); this less testing track could suit and she is worth a market check.

runners.name: Tomarlo
runners.comment: AW winner, best turf efforts last two starts, down 3lb and not a bad draw, chance
runners.spotlight: AW winner has yet to score in six starts on turf but has not been far away the last twice at Naas (5f, good) and Tipperary (5f, yielding); down 3lb and not badly drawn; place chance at least.

quotes.race: Book Online At dundalkstadium.com Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Tomarlo will actually end up being a nice horse. I think there is a nursery for him here in two weeks' time over five, so we'll see - David Marnane, trainer

runners.name: Tino Pai
runners.comment: 0-6 on turf, has gone close on AW, ran well on turf at Cork last July, may need this run
runners.spotlight: Eleven-race maiden is 0-6 on turf; in good form when last seen at Dundalk in February, finishing a 0.5l second in a 5f maiden; ran well in a turf maiden at Cork last July when a 2.25l fourth of 12l but may need this after a break.

runners.name: Arctic Steps
runners.comment: Well beaten all three starts for this yard, no impact on h'cap debut, down 4lb, needs more
runners.spotlight: Long odds and well beaten in all three starts for this yard including when 50-1 for handicap debut at Naas on latest; down 4lb for that but a lot more needed.

runners.name: El Fontenaro
runners.comment: Went close off 2lb higher at Naas, off since poor AW run in November, check the market
runners.spotlight: Maiden went close in third handicap when a 1.5l second of 14 in a Naas nursery (5f, good) in September and 2lb lower now; has been off the track since poor run at Dundalk in November; chance on that Naas effort and worth a market check on seasonal return.

runners.name: Taudeni
runners.comment: Minor promise in three maidens, best watched in first h'cap unless the market speaks
runners.spotlight: Just minor promise when midfield in a trio of maidens at 6f-7f; best watched on handicap debut unless the market suggests otherwise.

runners.name: Tillys Company
runners.comment: Improved effort at Navan latest, this easier 5f should suit, drawn wide, place chance
runners.spotlight: 0-8 on turf; improved on her first two runs of 2025 when beaten 4.75l at Navan in first time blinkers (retained); this easier 5f should suit on the evidence of that run; wide draw not ideal but not discounted for place purposes.

runners.name: Far At Sea
runners.comment: No impact in handicaps the last twice, mark falling but hard to fancy on recent form
runners.spotlight: 0-6 on turf; finished third at Sligo (6f, good) in May but was beaten over 5l; no impact in handicaps the last twice; mark falling but hard to fancy on recent showings.

runners.name: Therussiancomposer
runners.comment: Modest form in maidens and handicaps, drops markedly in trip, can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Modest form in maidens and similar story in handicaps, the last two over 1m and 7f at Gowran on good and heavy ground respectively; can only be watched for now dropped markedly back in trip.

5:25.race_name: BoyleSports Pick Your Place Fillies Maiden
5:25.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places

runners.name: Al Rojo Vivo
runners.comment: Beaten in the region of 20l in four maidens from 6f to an extended 1m; very opposable
runners.spotlight: Beaten in the region of 20l in four maidens from 6f to an extended 1m; very opposable.

runners.name: Angelight
runners.comment: 325,000gns yearling; left debut effort behind to finish close up over 1m at Naas (good)
runners.spotlight: 325,000gns yearling; left debut effort behind to finish close up over 1m at Naas (good) and the winner has Listed-race aspirations; leading claims in this company.

runners.name: Givehertilxmas
runners.comment: Limitations exposed in her first three maidens and massive improvement is needed
runners.spotlight: Limitations exposed in her first three maidens and massive improvement is needed.

runners.name: Lil Angel
runners.comment: Will need more than at Navan but should be wiser here and she's up 2f in trip
runners.spotlight: Short in the betting at Navan (5f, good; 15-8) and only faded out of the picture late on; has to step up on that form but should be all the wiser and she's raised 2f in distance.

runners.name: Naoi
runners.comment: Beaten in the region of 4l in her first two races, the latest last week at the Curragh
runners.spotlight: Beaten in the region of 4l in her first two races, the latest last week at the Curragh (6f) when failing to live up to market expectations; returns to 7f (bred for further) and remains of interest.

runners.name: Rajala
runners.comment: Beaten about 10l at the Curragh (6f, good) but wasn't unfancied at 15-2
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 10l at the Curragh (6f, good) but wasn't unfancied at 15-2 and this 70,000gns yearling is no doubt capable of better.

runners.name: Senior Situation
runners.comment: Brought up the rear last week at the Curragh (7f, good) when a 250-1 chance
runners.spotlight: Brought up the rear last week at the Curragh (7f, good) when a 250-1 chance.

runners.name: Senti Qua
runners.comment: Showed more second time out at Naas (1m, good) but was only seventh and beaten 8.5l
runners.spotlight: Showed more second time out at Naas (1m, good) but was only seventh and beaten 8.5l.

runners.name: Vanderbilt House
runners.comment: Competitive this season in 6f maidens; strong form claims and the cheekpieces return
runners.spotlight: Now 0-5 but was close up on her Curragh comeback (6f, soft) when tried in cheekpieces and the form of her Sligo defeat (6f, good; blinkered) was franked this week when runner-up Shoney won easily at Tipperary; should stay 7f and cheekpieces are back.

runners.name: Western Dreamer
runners.comment: Wins nothing here on the form she showed at Gowran only nine days ago (1m, good)
runners.spotlight: Wins nothing here on the form she showed at Gowran only nine days ago (1m, good); headgear soon turned to.

5:58.race_name: BoyleSports Extra Places Every Day Handicap
5:58.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places

runners.name: One More Wave
runners.comment: Two-time AW winner at 5f-6f for former yard, stays 7f but lacks a run, watch on stable bow
runners.spotlight: Two-time AW winner at 5f-6f for Jonathan Portman is 0-5 on turf; bought for 10,000GNS in January; stays 7f but lacks a run and probably best watched on stable debut.

runners.name: On A Session

prev_owners.owner: Penton Hill Racing Limited & L O'Kane

runners.comment: Last won April 2023, promise on stable debut, excuses latest, drawn wide, place chance
runners.spotlight: 5-48 on turf; last win came in April 2023 for the Barrons; travelled well on debut for this yard but didn't get home on very testing ground; restless in stalls when midfield at Roscommon latest; handicapper giving him a chance but drawn wide; place chance.

quotes.race: Fridge Spares Wholesale Limited Handicap
quotes.quote: Plan A went wrong, it was a nightmare in the stalls and it unravelled a bit quickly, but fortunately Ben was able to bide his time and come with that perfect run. On A Session has been running in some seriously competitive races and nearly every time he's been in the first three. It's testament to him that he's been consistent each time - Nicola Barron, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Convincing
runners.comment: Handicap debutant, has run well in maidens, cheekpieces on, not a bad draw, may go well
runners.spotlight: Maiden is 0-3 on turf but has run well in defeat; 6.25l third of six on seasonal return at Killarney (1m, good) earlier this month (runner up Royal Entry now rated 90); cheekpieces go on for handicap debut; not badly drawn; could go well.

runners.name: Loingseoir
runners.owner: W Keeling & M C Grassick & Mrs M J Grassick

prev_owners.owner: Mrs M J Grassick/T Oliver Hudson/M C Grassick/W Keeling
Patrick Pearse & W Keeling & M C Grassick & Mrs M J Grassick
Patrick Pearse & M C Grassick & Mrs M J Grassick

runners.comment: Six time winner, beaten a nose latest, 1lb above last win, nicely drawn, can't discount
runners.spotlight: Six-time winner went agonisingly close to adding to his tally at Limerick last month (1m, sft-hvy); won off 1lb lower on good at Fairyhouse (7f) last September; nicely drawn and can't be discounted; declared to run at Fairyhouse on Thursday.

quotes.race: O'Reilly Consulting Group Supporting The IRFU Charitable Trust Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Loingseoir was 5lb higher than when winning this race last year. He loves that ground and coming home from off a strong pace. The handicapper hasn't been kind to him all year. He ran well at Galway but then got 3lb and it took a long time for him to get down to where he's competitive. He's a grand horse to have in the yard. I'm sure there'll be another race for him back here, he likes the Curragh - Michael Grassick, trainer

quotes.race: Fermoy Handicap
quotes.quote: He jumped a little slowly but I let him get into his rhythm. He quickened up well in the straight and won well at the line. He was good and tough. He stuck his head out and he galloped right to the line. He loved the ground - Mikey Sheehy, rider of Loingseoir

runners.name: Colugo
runners.comment: Ran well on debut at Gowran and at Dundalk the last twice, check market on h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Maiden's best turf effort came on debut at Gowran over 9.5f (good); ran respectably in defeat at Dundalk the last twice in maidens at 7f-1m; has been handed a nice draw and is worth a market check on handicap debut.

runners.name: Dragon Of Malta
runners.comment: Five time winner, 8lb below last win, Keane 2-4 on him, poorly drawn but could go well
runners.spotlight: 5-50 on turf; last win came off 76 at Listowel (7f, soft) in September 2023; 8lb lower here and has had a couple of spins over hurdles so will be fit for his return to the Flat; Keane booked (2-4 on him) and is ground versatile; wide draw not ideal but well-treated and could still go well.

quotes.race: Ardilaun Hotel Handicap
quotes.quote: Dragon Of Malta's form is very solid and there were a lot of ducks in a row today. It is hard to get him early in the year but he comes to form in the autumn and that's just him - Pat O'Donnell, trainer

quotes.race: Galway Handicap
quotes.quote: Dragon Of Malta is a strange horse who comes to form at this time of the year. You would associate that mostly with fillies but he definitely was under the weather and lethargic early in the season. He is fairly buzzing now - Pat O'Donnell, trainer.

runners.name: Dynamic Force
runners.comment: Beaten a head off this mark latest, unlucky on penultimate, wide draw, place chance
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner on turf; won a Killarney claimer last July; has gone close a few times for this yard including when beaten a head at Roscommon on latest (7.5f, good); unlucky in running on penultimate at Navan; same mark here but draw not ideal; place chance.

quotes.race: EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Dynamic Force did it nicely. He was a bit laid-back so he took time to learn and adjust as the race progressed, but he's got a lovely big stride and is a horse who has a future. I'll have to talk to the Middleham Park team about plans and we might just feel our way gradually and have a bigger target towards the end of the year or we could pitch him in somewhere nicer next time, but we'll see how he is. He's an exciting horse, but he's still got a bit to learn and is a bit raw. He'd shown enough at home, plenty to be honest, but he's so laid-back, which was a little concern of mine and that's maybe why he was a longer price than he should have been. I think he's more 6f than 5f and he may get further next year; his stride is quite eyecatching and he seems to do everything effortlessly as you could see with Danny, who didn't have to give him any urgings. He's a Kodiac with a good, strong, powerful action and I think he'd get through easier ground as well; extremes of either ground would not be right - Robert Cowell, trainer.

runners.name: Clonmacash

prev_owners.owner: Mark Devlin/Nigel O'Hare/Gary Devlin/Kabin Racing Syndicate

runners.comment: Three-time AW winner, well beaten on turf the last twice, poorly drawn, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Three-time AW winner is 0-12 on turf; went close at Dundalk in April but hasn't backed that up in two runs on the grass since at the Curragh; poorly drawn and others appeal more.

quotes.race: Book Online At DundalkStadium.com Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Clonmacash was found out here last day but the extra furlong suited and he did it well today - Wayne Hassett, rider

runners.name: Camachero
runners.comment: 0-4 on turf but showed clear promise in maidens, blinkers on, 7lb claimed, could go well
runners.spotlight: Eleven-race maiden is 0-4 on turf; shaped well at Dundalk in January (1m) but below par on last two starts at that venue; 10lb higher on turf due to promising maiden runs last year at 6f; blinkers on and promising jockey takes off 7lb; could go well.

runners.name: La La Lucrative
runners.comment: Up 8lb for pillar to post win at Roscommon, could be more to come, bold bid likely
runners.spotlight: Gained second win of career and first for this yard when making all and winning easily at Roscommon (7.5f, good); up 8lb but could be more to come; another bold bid looks likely.

stable_tour.quote: He's taken some time to come together mentally. He's a bit of a sensitive soul. He ran three times last year, finishing third twice in small fields. We started him back at 5f this year at Beverley, where he was still learning, and have stepped him up to 6f for his next run, which will be at Catterick on Thursday. 23-05-24

runners.name: Uncle Albert
runners.comment: Lost form since Cork win on heavy, no sign of revival latest, can only be watched for now
runners.spotlight: Impressive winner at Cork (7f, heavy) last March off 72 but lost form subsequently; no signs of a revival on seasonal reappearance at Gowran; down another 3lb but can only be watched until showing a bit more.

quotes.race: Buy Annual Membership Today Handicap
quotes.quote: Uncle Albert worked very well during the week. He is tough and genuine and loves that ground. There could be a nice pot to be won with him, although he is ground dependent - Kieran Cotter, trainer

runners.name: Brains
runners.comment: Eleven-time AW winner, third turf win on penultimate, struggled off revised mark latest
runners.spotlight: Eleven-time AW winner won third turf race at Leopardstown in March (1m, good); majority of best form is at that trip but struggled back there off revised mark latest; others appeal more.

quotes.race: www.roscommonracecourse.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: I got a lovely easy lead which I didn't think I would, there was plenty of pace on paper. I got a nice breather into Brains around the bend and he stayed at it well. The slower ground over this shorter trip definitely helped today - Adam Caffrey, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Run Forrest Run
runners.comment: Won at Cork last October, blinkers worn that day return, might need another run or two
runners.spotlight: Six-time winner on turf; won three for Mickey Fenton, the latest at Cork last October off 59 (6f, gd-yld) in first-time blinkers and they return here; always behind on debut for this yard at Naas in March; might need another run or two to hit top form.

quotes.race: Mallow Handicap
quotes.quote: Run Forrest Run jumped well and got plenty of cover early, as he can be a bit keen. Everything went to plan - Conor Stone-Walsh, rider.

quotes.race: NB Builders Merchants Novice Median Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: Run Forrest Run did it well enough, I was getting a bit lonely out in front a furlong out and with three quarters to go I thought oh no but he responded well. I think if something had come to me, he may have just stuck his neck out again. - Jack Mitchell, rider

runners.name: Cornahilt Soldier
runners.comment: Won at this meeting last year, 1lb lower, likes it here, strip fitter for latest, chance
runners.spotlight: Won the 3yo handicap on this card last year off 62; 1lb lower now and should strip fitter for her comeback run at the Curragh when sporting blinkers (removed); draw not perfect but dangerous to dismiss (course form figures at 7f read 221); considered.

runners.name: Daymer Bay
runners.comment: 0-12 on turf, well-beaten on stable debut, needs to improve, others preferred; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; 0-12 on turf; formerly trained by Eve Johnson Houghton; beaten 11.5l on debut for Ciaran Murphy at Gowran (1m, good) after a 219-day absence; could improve for that but needs to; others appeal more.

runners.name: Distillate
runners.owner: Mark Devlin & Nigel Ohare & Philip Smith

prev_owners.owner: N O'Hare/G Devlin/J McCrory/Kabin Racing Syndicate
Nigel O'Hare/Gary Devlin/Joseph McCrory/Kabin Racing Synd

runners.comment: Five time winner, won twice off higher marks last year, chance if gets a run; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; 4-50 on turf; won twice last year at Cork on quick ground off 65 and 62; races off 57 here so is well-handicapped and she has run well here before; not discounted if getting a run.

quotes.race: Starman At Tally-Ho Handicap
quotes.quote: Distillate has improved all the time. Hopefully the handicapper won't be too hard on her and she should be a good fun filly. We'll probably go back to Dundalk for the winter - Ado McGuinness, trainer

runners.name: Gegenpressing
runners.breeder: Saleh Al Homaizi & Imad Al Sagar
runners.comment: Five-time turf winner, has won over C&D, won at Sligo penultimate, well drawn; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; five-time turf winner including over C&D; won at Sligo in May off 53, his second year in a row winning that race; didn't get a clear run when beaten 5.75l at the Curragh latest; could go well from plum draw if gets in.

quotes.race: Tote Never Beaten By SP Handicap
quotes.quote: Gegenpressing loves these summer tracks and all four of his wins have come right-handed. I thought he got there too soon but he held on and, with a bit of luck, he might pick up another one or two off the marks he'll be off - Patrick Harty, joint trainer.

6:33.race_name: BoyleSports Home Of The Early Payout Handicap
6:33.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places

runners.name: Charanda
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: 0-4 on turf, best form on AW, well beaten in 1m claimer on soft latest, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Thirteen race maiden is 0-4 on turf; best efforts have come on the AW and was well beaten in a claimer at Gowran (1m, soft) last month; others preferred.

runners.name: Remember The Bear
runners.comment: Formerly British trained, form of last run boosted but best watched on stable-h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Formerly trained in Britain by Kevin Phillapart De Foy; her latest second came in a two-runner race at Newcastle (5f); the winner has won twice since but she is probably best watched on her handicap and stable debut.

runners.name: Weegeebear
runners.owner: Mark Devlin & Nigel Ohare & Philip Smith
runners.comment: 1-12 on turf, won Gowran claimer in April (Charanda behind), not discounted back at 7f
runners.spotlight: AW winner is 1-12 on turf; that win came in a 1m claimer at Gowran (soft) in April when he had Charanda well behind; 9.5f may have stretched him in a Ballinrobe claimer latest; not discounted back at 7f and rain would be a plus.

quotes.race: Golf At Gowran Park Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Weegeebear actually jumped slow and I went to plan B straightaway, down the rail. I was able to scoot up their inside turning the bend and got a really nice position. He travelled into the straight really well and quickened up. He's hit the line strong. He had been slowly away at Bellewstown last time. When you jump slow around Bellewstown it's hard to get into it, we struggled all the way really. I'm glad he's gone and done it today - Adam Caffrey, jockey.

runners.name: Bamako
runners.comment: 0-5 on turf, ran well in C&D maiden last season, come on for latest, visored, outrun odds
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden is 0-5 on turf; best effort came over C&D last June in a maiden (good) in first time cheekpieces; finished last on return at Naas but could come on for that and now tries a visor; could go well at a price.

runners.name: Sovereign Banter
runners.comment: Modest form until improved effort in maiden claimer latest, cheekpieces on, drawn wide
runners.spotlight: Modest form in maidens and first two handicaps; improved effort in 7.5f Roscommon maiden claimer latest; cheekpieces go on for return to handicaps; drawn wide; others preferred.

runners.name: Annie Lavinia
runners.comment: Maiden, stayed on well over 6f at Navan, down 4lb, Lee takes over, claims back at 7f
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden is 0-3 on turf; ran on well over 6f at Navan latest where beaten just 4.5l into fifth of 19; dropped 4lb, stepping back up to 7f will suit and Billy Lee takes over; claims.

runners.name: Eric Lock
runners.comment: Maiden went close off this mark at Naas on soft-heavy, handles good, Keane up, chance
runners.spotlight: Maiden is 0-8 on turf but has been running respectably in defeat; went close at Naas in March off 53 (5f, sft-hvy); another decent effort on good at Bellewstown latest (5f); not without a chance back up in trip with Keane booked.

runners.name: Jasmine Affanalis
runners.comment: Handicap debutante, well beaten in maidens at 7f-1m, watch on handicap and turf debut
runners.spotlight: Long odds and well-beaten in a trio of maidens at 7f-1m on the AW; switches to turf for handicap debut; not badly drawn but probably best watched.

runners.name: Micasso
runners.comment: Improved on h'cap debut at Navan, just behind Anna Lavinia, 2lb worse off, drawn wide
runners.spotlight: Much-improved effort on handicap debut at Navan on latest (6f, good); just behind Anna Lavinia that day and didn't get the clearest of runs; however, is 2lb worse off here and drawn wide.

runners.name: Searcog
runners.comment: H'cap debutante, promise second start at Leopardstown, lacks a run, drawn wide, watch
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante showed promise in maidens; beaten just 2.75l on second start when seventh of 18 at Leopardstown (7f, good); lacks a run and drawn wide; probably best watched on this occasion.

runners.name: Letters Of Love
runners.comment: 0-4 on turf, better effort in maiden claimer latest, drawn wide, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden is 0-4 on turf; didn't get the clearest of runs when a 4.5l third in a maiden claimer at Roscommon latest (7.5f, good); poorly drawn for return to handicap company; others appeal more.

runners.name: Breath Of You
runners.comment: Close up behind a couple of these at Navan, well drawn, trip will suit, interesting
runners.spotlight: First sign of winning potential since joining this yard when seventh behind a couple of these at Navan (6f, good) in first time cheekpieces (retained); dropped 5lb for that; shaped like this trip would suit and she is well drawn today; interesting.

runners.name: Undefeatable
runners.comment: 0-3 on turf, best form at Dundalk, lacks a run, opposable on the balance of form
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden is 0-3 on turf; ran well at Dundalk (6f) in November when a 1.5l third of 14 off 56; off since poor effort over 7f there later that month; lacks a recent run and opposable on balance of form, though yard did win this last year.

runners.name: Kilgharrahs Love
runners.comment: 0-7 on turf, best form is on testing ground, well drawn but may need softer conditions
runners.spotlight: 0-7 on turf, two best runs have come on testing ground over 7f at Gowran; beaten 6.25l when fourth of 10 there on latest off 52; well-drawn and dropped 4lb for that run but may want softer ground.

runners.name: Merchants Arch
runners.comment: 0-6 on turf, best form on AW, well beaten on latest, cheekpieces on, needs more; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; 0-11 overall and 0-6 on turf; best efforts have come on the AW; well-beaten on heavy ground at Gowran latest (1m); drops in trip and different ground here; needs more in first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Esque Elegance
runners.comment: Maiden, best form has come on AW, well beaten on turf latest, others preferred; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; maiden is 0-4 on turf; has run well in defeat on the AW but has failed to replicate it on the grass; beaten 17l on latest at Tipperary (1m1f, yielding); drop in trip a plus but others appeal more.

runners.name: Ms Olivia
runners.breeder: Mr J B A Al Attiyah
runners.owner: Riverstown Racing Syndicate/N Ohare/E Hughes/K Cromwell
runners.comment: Handicap debutante, no show in maidens, tongue tied, yard in form, check market; reserve
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante; not much promise in three maidens at 5f-7f when long odds; tongue tie goes on; yard in flying form so worth a market check if getting a run.

7:08.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places

runners.name: Cristal Clere

prev_owners.owner: G & M Roberts, Green, Savidge & Whittal-Williams

runners.comment: 7f too short on comeback run and last year's peak form gives him each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Ran perfectly well after a break at Tipperary where 7f was way too short; last year's peak form, and he ran some fine races in defeat, gives him each-way claims.

quotes.race: SHEIN Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Cristal Clere had great runs last summer and is a really consistent horse. He took off on the soft ground the other day and again today - John Nallen, trainer.

runners.name: Samui
runners.comment: Ran okay in his final hurdle race and this guaranteed stayer should give his running
runners.spotlight: Won the 1m2f maiden on this card last year and progressed to much better things under both codes, including placed efforts at Listed level; ran okay in his final hurdle race and this guaranteed stayer should give his running.

quotes.race: Liam Healy Memorial Lartigue Hurdle (Handicap) (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Samui went through it better than most although the ground was a worry. I don't think he's a winter horse but he could head to Cheltenham in November - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballyduff Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Samui won snug. He had a very good run the last day and I was very confident coming here today - Keith Donoghue, rider

quotes.race: Christopher Dunne Memorial (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Samui is a grand horse. He had a good blow after the race and there is a good bit of improvement in him. He was still green and he only started to gallop when he got to the front - Gordon Elliott, trainer

stable_tour.quote: Has been a revelation on the Flat this year and hopefully he can carry that improvement to hurdling. He doesn't look to have a bad mark at all when you look through some of his Flat form. 28-10-24

runners.name: Shanroe

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late Brian Smyth

runners.comment: Multiple winner but an 11yo now and was pulled up over hurdles at Killarney only recently
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner under both codes down the years, his last success a Listed race at Chester in September 2023; however, an 11yo now and was pulled up over hurdles at Killarney only recently.

quotes.race: Caa Stellar Chester Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: These are Robbie's [Colgan] tactics because he normally rides him but Jason [Hart] did a fantastic job. Shanroe is not the easiest horse to travel with, we have to do things to suit him. Sometimes we bring him over and put him in a field and sometimes we travel a Shetland pony over with him but he was absolutely fine today - Karl Thornton, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Rockshore Refreshingly Irish Race
quotes.quote: Shanroe finds plenty, he's tough. Robbie realised they didn't go hard and didn't know whether to go on and then it was tactical. The rain came, he's not the easiest to train but when he's right he's good - Karl Thornton, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Race To The Ebor Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Shanroe must be a very good horse as Robbie said he was behind the bridle today but he battled really well. He said the ground was as quick as he'd want it. The money in the Ebor is very tempting and maybe we could fly him over - Karl Thornton, trainer.

quotes.race: Farmhouse Foods Novice Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shanroe will head back to the Flat now and we'll target premier handicaps. I wouldn't imagine we'll head over hurdles for a while. I still think he's well handicapped on the Flat and there's the same prize money there as taking a chance over hurdles. He's still learning his trade over hurdles, he's not that natural but jumped well today. He was always a horse that'd take time over hurdles. He's now won three bumpers, two hurdles races and two races on the Flat - I wouldn't mind another one like him! - Karl Thornton, trainer.

quotes.race: Oola Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's a little bit green and that was why I brought him to England previously. I was going to run him on the Flat at the Curragh on Sunday but we opted to come here on safe ground. I don't think he'll go to Galway, my horses don't tend to go around there for whatever reason - Karl Thornton, trainer of Shanroe

quotes.race: Paxtons For Milwaukee Power Tools Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: That didn't suit Shanroe. There was no gallop but he's a good horse who will be suited by more of a galloping track - Karl Thornton, trainer

runners.name: Taipan
runners.comment: Solid return over 1m6f at Gowran but has the second lowest handicap mark of these
runners.spotlight: Four-time Flat winner who returned with a solid effort in defeat behind the evergreen Falcon Flight at Gowran (1m6f); has the second lowest handicap mark of these, however.

quotes.race: Rockshore Refreshingly Irish Race
quotes.quote: Taipan has been ready to run for about six weeks but the ground has come up quick, he just needs a little ease. He might have another go at the Cesarewitch and maybe the English one too - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Taipan is a gorgeous laid back horse and we gave him all the time in the world. I wasn't sure if today was his day, he never travelled at any stage but that's the way he is at home. He'll be a lovely staying horse for next year - Shane Foley, rider

stable_tour.quote: He'll go for a winners' of one race at Killarney next and we'll aim him at a premier handicap on Guineas weekend at the Curragh. The key to him is a little bit of ease in the ground, he doesn't need it quite as soft as he used to. 21-04-23

This beautiful son of Frankel was one we gave plenty of time to last season. He finally made his debut on November 1 at Naas, where he was drawn on the outside in stall 17 of 18. I told Shane [Foley] to let the race unfold and see what happened. He wasn't very quickly away and was mid-division but easily made his way through the field and went fourth with a furlong left to run, then once Shane asked him he ran on strongly to take the race. I was delighted with that effort as he justified the faith I've always had in him. This big, raw horse has really thrived physically since then. If all goes well the plan is to start him off in the Ballysax Stakes at Leopardstown over 1m2f next month and I'd say he'll get 1m4f in time. He's an exciting prospect. 17-03-21

runners.name: Dallas Star
runners.breeder: E Dieuaide & Domaine Billard Et Fils
runners.comment: Ran as well as he was entitled to behind Kyprios in the Group 3 Saval Beg
runners.spotlight: Won last year's Ballysax before finishing tailed off in the Derby; looks better than ever this year and ran as well as he was entitled to behind Kyprios in the Group 3 Saval Beg at Leopardstown (1m6f, good); that was a new trip for him and he saw it out well.

quotes.race: P.W. McGrath Memorial Ballysax Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Dallas Star will be entered in all the big races now I suppose and we'll see where we go. I'll have to chat to Kia [Joorabchian, owner] and Robson [Aguiar] and see where they want to go. He came to us over the winter and is a lovely horse - Adrian Murray, trainer.

quotes.race: British EBF Future Stayers' Novice Stakes (Sire And Dam Restricted Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dallas Star is s a lovely horse and has always been a big, raw type. His first run was good at Haydock and then we pitched him in deep in the Chesham, and he ran well, but I stress he's big and raw and has taken time. Rossa says he'll be nicer again next year when he'll want further. I remember saying to someone at Haydock he could be an Ebor horse one day and I haven't changed my mind - he'll be a nice, staying type. This ground isn't essential, but he enjoys it - Dominic Ffrench Davis, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been running really well. He came to us with a big reputation from Robson Aguiar, who pretrains all the Amo horses, and he thought a lot of him. He has proved to be a nice horse and I remember saying after his first run that he might be an Ebor horse one day and I still think he will be. I think he'll be a lovely staying type of horse, it's just a case of keeping him on the right side of the handicapper and bringing him along nice and slowly. He's had a bit of a break but you can expect to see him out before the end of the year and we'd like to find him a race he could win rather than pitching him in too deep. 21-09-23

runners.name: Duraji
runners.comment: Finished behind Dallas Star last time; only had the four races so not exposed just yet
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced half-brother to top-class Ghaiyyath; 1m2f maiden last summer; patiently ridden on first attempt at 1m6f in the Saval Beg but never got involved and finished behind Dallas Star; only had the four races so not exposed just yet.

runners.name: Poetic Sound
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo; excellent run behind Kyprios suggests he's very progressive
runners.spotlight: Dual winner who was having only his fifth career start when a front-running third to Kyprios in the Listed Vintage Crop at Navan and runner-up Enfranchise has since gone close in a German Group 2; perhaps a shade flattered that day but this 4yo is improving by the looks and is of strong interest.

quotes.race: Kilsaran Race
quotes.quote: Poetic Sound is a gorgeous horse. He was lost halfway through at Roscommon last time but he travelled better today, so he's learning on the job. Hopefully we'll have one more run before we put him away and we'll look forward to next year with him. I'd say even a mile and six is his minimum trip. We could go to the November Handicap but we'll see if he's street smart enough for that - Ger Lyons, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: District Speciality Coffee Apprentice Maiden
quotes.quote: Poetic Sound is a nice horse. He has plenty of ability but he is still very raw and green. Once I got rolling up the straight though I thought I would get there. Once the penny dropped he ran on well - James Ryan, rider.

runners.name: Goodie Two Shoes
runners.comment: Dual-purpose mare; entitled to win a 1m6f Listed race at Gowran 23 days ago (good)
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose mare; entitled to win a 1m6f Listed race at Gowran 23 days ago (good), which she did by some 6l; likeable 6yo but she's in a lot deeper here.

quotes.race: McEnery Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: It's nice to see Goodie Two Shoes back in good form, she did it nicely. I'd say she will mix it between the Flat and hurdles. She had a hard fall at Fairyhouse that set her back a bit so it's good to see her back - Frank Berry, owner's racing manager.

quotes.race: Punchestown Race
quotes.quote: Goodie Two Shoes learned a bit from Killarney and I would say that was a good performance, it rode a lot sharper today. 1m4f would suit her - Frank Berry, racing manager to J.P. McManus.

stable_tour.quote: It was great to see her get off the mark over hurdles at Killarney. She doesn't want the ground too heavy so we'll have to pick the right spots for her, but I think she is capable of getting some black type over hurdles. 27-11-23

runners.name: La Isla Mujeres
runners.breeder: S A R L Al Shahania Stud France
runners.comment: Classy mare who held her own in a Group 3 the last time; has potential over this new trip
runners.spotlight: Bought for 330,000gns after winning two of her six races for Ralph Beckett; comfortably saw off Cristal Clere in a 1m4f Listed race at Roscommon last summer before holding her own in a Group 3; unraced beyond 1m4f but good chance that she'll stay and returns with yard having winners.

quotes.race: British European Breeders Fund EBF Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: La Isla Mujeres settled well. We went steady and the race worked out nicely for me. We moved onto the rail and I was going well in front, but I am not convinced she quite got home today - Hector Crouch, jockey.

runners.name: Royal Entry
runners.comment: Recent maiden winner; faces no easy task on these terms and Billy Lee rides her stablemate
runners.spotlight: Smart form in defeat before getting off the mark at the eighth attempt in a 1m4f maiden at Cork; faces no easy task on these terms and Billy Lee rides her stablemate.

7:43.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places

runners.name: Among The Pines
runners.comment: 100-1, slowly away and always behind on belated debut at Leopardstown (7f)
runners.spotlight: 100-1, slowly away and always behind on belated debut at Leopardstown (7f).

runners.name: Atheneum
runners.comment: Only third of four runners on one run last year but that was a tough assignment
runners.spotlight: Beaten 17l when third of four at Killarney last summer (1m, good) but that was a tough starter against talented opposition; difficult to assess and perhaps the market can guide.

runners.name: Bursinel
runners.comment: Has performed okay in last two maiden hurdles but don't see him winning this
runners.spotlight: Fair form without winning for William Haggas; has performed okay in last two maiden hurdles but don't see him winning this.

runners.name: Diesel Deans
runners.comment: In trouble some way out when beaten 15l at Gowran (1m1f; 14-1)
runners.spotlight: In trouble some way out when beaten 15l at Gowran (1m1f; 14-1); that was an underwhelming start.

runners.name: First Ascent
runners.comment: Godolphin cast-off recruited for only 3,000gns; minor form in his first two races
runners.spotlight: Godolphin cast-off recruited for only 3,000gns; minor form in his first two races and handicaps will be more like it.

runners.name: Milverton
runners.comment: Beaten 11l when second on bumper debut and achieved little since
runners.spotlight: Beaten 11l when second on bumper debut and achieved little since, latterly in 1m4f maidens at the Curragh.

runners.name: Colpe Cross
runners.comment: 25,000euros yearling; out of a 6f winner and close relative of smart West Wind Blows
runners.spotlight: 25,000euros yearling; first foal; dam 6f 2yo winner (RPR 85), closely related to 1m2f Group 3 winner West Wind Blows; nicely bred and needs checking in the betting.

runners.name: Navy Waters
runners.comment: Sets the standard on her two seconds; the fitting of a visor is slightly concerning
runners.spotlight: Plenty of positives to take out of both her runs and kept the odds-on Twomey-trained favourite honest last time at Ballinrobe (extended 1m1f); she's bred to appreciate this stiffer stamina test but the fitting of a visor is slightly concerning.

runners.name: Rosemount
runners.comment: 150-1 when pulled up in a maiden hurdle at Navan and no appeal on the back of that
runners.spotlight: 150-1 when pulled up in a maiden hurdle at Navan and no appeal on the back of that.

runners.name: Seo Linn
runners.owner: Mrs A Phelan & Mrs Bridget Beckett
runners.comment: High-class bumper performer and an intriguing contender now switching codes
runners.spotlight: Smart bumper form, winning a Listed race at Cheltenham in November (good) and following up in the Grade 2 for mares at Aintree (good to soft); turned over at short odds at Punchestown (Grade 3) but still ran well after racing keenly; intriguing contender now switching codes and yard in hot form.

quotes.race: Goffs Nickel Coin Mares' Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was very good. I think Seo Linn will be a good filly on the Flat. There's a good staying programme for her there and we'll look at that. She seemed to be enjoying herself - we came here hoping she was ready to do her thing, and she was. She's grown up - she was a little bit fractious at Cheltenham, but she's learning and she's going and she's improving - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

runners.name: Spring Dance
runners.comment: Promising third at Gowran and that form gives her similar claims to Navy Waters
runners.spotlight: Very likeable first run when close up over the extended 1m1f at Gowran and back in fourth there was Victoria Kesia who would go on to beat Navy Waters at Limerick; good chance.

8:18.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places

runners.name: Angelo Pio
runners.comment: Rated 68, good h'cap efforts last twice, slowly away latest, thereabouts if starts better
runners.spotlight: Rated 68; promise in second maiden at Dundalk at 1m and similar story in first two turf handicaps when slowly away; thereabouts if getting away on level terms.

runners.name: Beat The Devil
runners.comment: Best effort on latest in 7.5f maiden claimer, stamina to prove back in maiden company
runners.spotlight: Twice raced; best effort on latest, a 7.25l fifth of 12 in a maiden claimer at Roscommon (7.5f); stamina to prove here and more needed.

runners.name: Broadstone
runners.comment: Rated 68, promise in maidens at 7f-1m, longer trip a query but not discounted; cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Rated 68; promise in all three maidens at 7f-1m on varying ground; hasn't looked like he was crying out for this longer trip but pedigree suggests it might suit; cheekpieces go on; can't discount.

runners.name: Cooleys Mist
runners.comment: Promise on good on debut, may not have acted on soft latest, not dismissed for local yard
runners.spotlight: One of two for stable; promise on debut at Leopardstown in early April (1m2f, good); may not have acted on soft at the Curragh latest; not dismissed for local yard.

runners.name: Diva Time
runners.comment: Well beaten at big odds at Dundalk last year, gelded since, steps up in trip, best watched
runners.spotlight: Well-beaten at big prices in two starts at Dundalk late last year at 7f-1m; has been gelded; best watched.

runners.name: Georg Zhukov
runners.comment: Rated 70 on turf, no show in h'caps last twice, hood and tongue tie need to revive
runners.spotlight: Rated 70 on turf; standout effort a 6.5l second of 14 in a Thurles maiden last October; no impact in handicaps this year, though soft ground may not have suited latest; hood and tongue tie tried.

runners.name: Minella Boss
runners.comment: Promise both starts last season, may have needed latest, chance if handles better ground
runners.spotlight: Rated 69; promise in two maidens last Autumn; well-beaten at 33-1 on return at Navan (1m2f, soft); may have needed that but good ground would be an unknown; chance if handles it.

runners.name: Nakatomi
runners.comment: Rated 69, beaten in Sligo h'cap latest, respected with David Egan up but others preferred
runners.spotlight: Rated 69; hung right when beaten 7.25l in Sligo handicap on latest earlier this month; David Egan takes over from 7lb claimer; respected but others look more likely.

runners.name: Rubadub Dubh
runners.comment: Rated 67, promise on second start, didn't build on that latest, a bit to prove for now
runners.spotlight: Rated 67; promisel on second start when a 7.75l fifth of 12 at Navan; failed to back that up in a maiden claimer latest; a bit to prove stepped back up in trip.

runners.name: Summer Island
