runners.owner: Nigel Ohare/Martin W White/Mark Devlin/Rockview Stables
runners.comment: Poor on soft on debut, stayed on over 1m on good ground latest, up in trip, may go well
runners.spotlight: Weakened on debut on soft at Cork; much better at Leopardstown (1m, good) last time when running on well in the closing stages; this longer trip should suit on that evidence; could go well.

runners.name: Alba Chiara
runners.owner: D W Sloan & C G Bryson & Mrs Tracey Ohare
runners.comment: Ran on well on debut (1m), didn't stay 1m4f latest, preferred by Lordan, not discounted
runners.spotlight: Second runner for local yard; stayed on for a 9.5l fifth of 13 on debut at the Curragh (1m); didn't stay 1m4f on testing ground on return at Limerick; preferred by Lordan but a bit to prove.

runners.name: Electric Beauty
runners.comment: Promise in maidens on AW, related to turf winners, Billy Lee up, cheekpieces, interesting
runners.spotlight: Caught the eye on debut at Dundalk (1m) when fourth after missing the kick; went one place better there in January but beaten 10l on latest in February when ridden forward; related to turf winners, Billy Lee booked and cheekpieces go on; interesting.

runners.name: Lady Plimsoll
runners.comment: Rated 70, best effort on second start on AW, hasn't matched that since, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Rated 70 based on 2.75l second at Dundalk (1m); hasn't matched that since; beaten 5.5l in 1m Ayr maiden on turf debut latest; upped in trip; others appeal more.

runners.name: Tirhakah
runners.comment: Well-beaten on sft-hvy first two starts, may improve for better ground, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Fairly well-beaten in both starts to date, over 1m2f at the Curragh (soft) and 1m4f at Limerick (sft-hvy); drops back in trip but others preferred.

5:05.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Selective watering)

runners.name: Aclass
runners.comment: Promising chase debut at Wexford last month; could do with more rain.
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles, best efforts have come on very testing ground; promising chasing debut on yielding last month when only weakening approaching last when fourth in 2m4f Wexford handicap; could do with more rain.

runners.name: Aussie Warrior
runners.comment: Hurdles form is on decent ground so won't want too much rain on chase debut
runners.spotlight: Hurdles win came in 2m Roscommon 4yo maiden on good, twice runner-up in handicaps at same trip last summer; didn't count in competitive Fairyhouse handicap last month after long absence and now switches to fences; won't want too much rain.

runners.name: Figurehead
runners.comment: Modest dual-purpose maiden best watched now on chase debut
runners.spotlight: 36-race maiden, best hurdles form has been on soft; ran on AW over the winter and now tries chasing but seems best watched.

runners.name: Jersey Des Brosses
runners.breeder: M Pierre Lecoq & M Augustin Lecoq
runners.comment: Disappointing so far in bumpers/hurdles but don't rule out improvement now sent chasing
runners.spotlight: Expensive purchase has so far failed to live up to his price tag in bumpers and over hurdles; don't rule out improvement now sent chasing though.

stable_tour.quote: He's better than the bare form. He was just a bit weak last season, but he's much stronger now and you'll see a different side to him. 28-10-24

runners.name: Mullanour
runners.comment: Second in 2m6f handicap hurdle here last month (yielding); one to consider on chase debut
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner on nice ground a year ago; best hurdle runs when close second to in-form rival at Limerick (heavy) and latest when second to Stumblin In in 2m6f handicap here last month (yielding), having been made plenty of use of; one to consider on chasing debut given his record here.

runners.name: Penalty Try
runners.comment: Limited opportunities hurdling with Ross O'Sullivan; chasing debut after 14 months absence
runners.spotlight: Never better than mid-division in maiden hurdles, showing some promise at Fairyhouse (2m, heavy); stopped quickly and pulled up on handicap debut at Cork in April 2024 when last seen for Ross O'Sullivan; best watched after such an absence on chasing debut here.

runners.name: Roxboro River
runners.comment: Glimpses of ability over hurdles, not an obvious one to make an immediate impact chasing
runners.spotlight: Glimpses of ability over hurdles, including when second in 4-runner 3m1f Warwick handicap last month; faded badly at Sligo latest; not an obvious one to make an immediate impact chasing.

runners.name: Star In The Park
runners.comment: Stiff task when remote last of five on last week's chasing debut at Sligo; best watched
runners.spotlight: Stiff task when remote last of five on last week's chasing debut in 2m4f Sligo beginners'; best watched.

runners.name: Walkonthebriteside
runners.comment: Veterinary excuses both chase starts; caution advised but can't rule out
runners.spotlight: Won 3m Wexford handicap hurdle last August on good ground but soundly beaten favourite on both chase attempts when veterinary excuses, latest when blood in nostrils after being pulled up at Clonmel in March; back from a short break and caution advised but can't rule out.

runners.name: Laurie Blue
runners.comment: Entitled to come for recent comeback run here and now tries fences
runners.spotlight: Placed in a point-to-point on good ground in 2022; huge odds first three starts over hurdles, showing some promise at Down Royal (soft); emerged from 426-day absence when pulled up in 2m4f mares maiden here 13 days ago; stoutly-bred mare now switches to fences.

runners.name: Sights Unseen
runners.comment: In-form hurdler could prove hard to beat on chasing debut if avoiding serious error
runners.spotlight: One of the few runners here who bring good recent hurdles form with them, having twice gone close before landing 2m6f Downpatrick handicap a week ago (good) under regular 7lb claimer; senior rider now takes over for chasing debut and if avoiding serious error over these forgiving fences could prove hard to beat.

runners.name: Stumblin In
runners.comment: Hurdles win here last month makes her a likely leading player
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark here in 2m6f handicap hurdle last month (yielding) when beating Mullanour; renews rivalry with that rival here on much better terms for chase debut, having bombed out at Kilbeggan last time.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: That was lovely. Stumblin In was in season when third at Wexford last year and we probably shouldn't have brought her to Downpatrick then. She is owned by Michael Fanning who is a neighbour of mine and I'm delighted for him - Pat Doyle, trainer.

5:35.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Selective watering)

runners.name: Arctic Gale
runners.comment: Respected on chase debut though has a bit to find with some of these on hurdles rating
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; second in three maiden hurdles last summer at up to 2m7f; disappointing on return from winter break on last month's handicap debut at Fairyhouse but still respected here on chase debut, though has a bit to find with some of these on hurdles rating.

runners.name: Men Of Dreams
runners.comment: Winning hurdler but pulled up on only previous try chasing; best left alone
runners.spotlight: Sole win came in 2m3f Kilbeggan maiden two years ago; low-grade flat maiden and pulled up on only previous try chasing; best left alone.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Men Of Dreams was always a good horse to jump. Ricky Doyle said to go hurdling with him and then maybe go back to the Flat and try to exploit his mark - Johnny Levins, trainer

runners.name: Serienmond
runners.comment: Progressive 2m handicap hurdler last season; big player if taking to fences here
runners.spotlight: German Flat winner; progressive 2m handicap hurdler this past season, winning at Leopardstown and good third in valuable Fairyhouse contest; solid run at Punchestown festival final start off aggregate 14lb higher mark; big player if taking to fences here.

quotes.race: Cancer Fund For Children Charity Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: They went a great gallop which helped Serienmond settle. He's been very keen at home since he came to us, and we've been working hard on just trying to get him to do things right. He jumped well and did everything right. It wasn't a great race on paper so hopefully the handicapper is not too hard on him - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.name: Starzov
runners.comment: Regressive hurdler was well beaten on recent chasing debut at Kilbeggan; best watched
runners.spotlight: Regressive hurdler was well beaten on recent chasing debut at Kilbeggan; best watched for now.

quotes.race: McCarthy Plant & Agri Sales Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Starzov possibly wants better ground and a bit further. With it being soft today, we said we'd go back to two miles and try to outstay them - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.name: The Names Jock
runners.comment: Decent flat/hurdles winner but recent form below best; belated chasing debut
runners.spotlight: Four-time flat winner in former years and also won a maiden hurdle; recent flat-hurdles form leaves question marks now on belated chase debut, market could prove informative.

quotes.race: McSweeney Brothers Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: We always liked The Names Jock but he's got a bit high in the handicap on the Flat and we have this to turn to now and I hope he'll turn into a nice novice. He seems to have a little bit of class. He might not be a winter horse but he's a nice horse for this kind of ground. I was anxious to see if he would jump as good on the track as he would at home. It took him into the race as there was a fair good gallop - John Kiely, trainer.

quotes.race: Sligo Races Hospitality Handicap
quotes.quote: We'll look for another race on the Flat but the plan is to go hurdling with him - John Kiely, trainer

quotes.race: Mallow Handicap
quotes.quote: Ted Durkan is now an agent and he bought him for the Gleesons and it doesn't look like he made a mistake. We are very pleased because he probably needed the run the last day and it was good he justified that Navan run. He doesn't look short of pace and we're hoping he will continue to improve another bit and the plan is to go hurdling later in the year - John Kiely, trainer

runners.name: Wonleg
runners.comment: Let down by jumping on recent chase bow; these easier fences could suit so don't rule out
runners.spotlight: Won Roscommon maiden hurdle (2m, soft) on rules debut last September (form franked) but well held twice afterwards and none too fluent on recent chasing debut in first-time hood at Tipperary when well beaten; these easier fences could suit so don't rule out.

runners.name: Belle The Lioness
runners.comment: Never sighted on recent chase/yard debut at Tipperary early this month; hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Bumper/maiden hurdle winner for Henry de Bromhead; pulled up in handicap here on return from absence in January and never sighted on recent chase debut for current yard at Tipperary early this month; hard to fancy right now.

quotes.race: Cork & Waterford Mares' Point-To-Point Flat Race
quotes.quote: Belle The Lioness was really good. She was keen at home and it was just about getting her to switch off today and learn. She switched off, I could get into the race whenever I wanted and she quickened on down the straight. She was still green and was pricking her ears - Davy Roche, rider.

stable_tour.quote: We'll go back to two miles with her, I'd imagine. She ran okay at Wexford on Friday but I thought she might go a bit closer. We'll probably try fences with her sooner rather than later. 20-11-23

She won a Cork bumper by five lengths on her only start last season. This season she had a couple of good seconds over hurdles and then got her head in front last time at Thurles. Each of her defeats was strong form and her recent run shows she's progressive. She'll go for the Ryanair Mares' Novices' Hurdle at Cheltenham. 01-03-23

runners.name: Florance
runners.comment: Rated a meagre 85 hurdling; blinkers fitted for chasing debut but hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: Placed in a bumper but 0-4 hurdling and rated a meagre 85; blinkers fitted for chasing debut but hard to make a case for.

6:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Selective watering)

runners.name: Clarens
runners.comment: C&D novice winner would have gone closer but for being hampered latest; big chance
runners.spotlight: Four-time hurdles winner and off the mark over fences at second attempt in C&D novice last month when making all; likely would have gone closer but for being hampered when third in Tipperary handicap latest so potential remains off this mark.

quotes.race: Hotel Park St. Johann In Tirol Austria Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Clarens was second last year and it was in my mind to come back here. He was well in with Alex Harvey's claim and we got there in time. He loves it here and we might look for something else here - John Flavin, trainer.

quotes.race: Navan Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I would say Clarens learnt more today than ever before because he was shuffled back further than we wanted, and to be fair to Jack [Foley], he sat with him and had to come wide. Thankfully he jumped the last well and stayed going. It was lovely. He's improving all the time. Today was the plan, but there is a novice handicap in Leopardstown on St Stephen's Day and we might go there - John Flavin, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Clarens is a lovely little horse that has taken time to come to himself. I told Jack to ride him good and positive and he jumped very well. I was hopeful of a good run - John Flavin, trainer.

runners.name: Be Fierce
runners.comment: Winner of last two visits here; goes well fresh and respected in first handicap chase
runners.spotlight: Likes it here, winning on last two visits; 2m handicap hurdle in October (yielding) and on second attempt chasing in C&D novice in January on heavy (third has won recently); goes well fresh and has to be respected in first handicap given his record here.

runners.name: Lake Chad
runners.comment: Dual winner here over further; below best of late but can't rule out back here
runners.spotlight: Four chase wins include twice here (2m5/2m6f) and over 2m at Thurles in February; jumping a bit awry of late but can't be ruled out back here over these easier fences.

quotes.race: Racing Again February 20th Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lake Chad winged the third last and I didn't want to disappoint him and I kept him rolling. He knows his job and he is some servant. He just sees out his races and he was always doing enough to win - Niall Moore, rider

quotes.race: McCarthy's Irish Bar Lexington Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lake Chad is better around here than anywhere else. He has won here before and has always run a good race here. He ran terrible the last day and I don't know why he ran so poor. The ground was soft in Roscommon that day. It was a big improvement today - Philip Fenton, trainer.

quotes.race: Waterford Chamber Of Commerce Beginners' Chase
quotes.quote: Lake Chad will maybe get a little break now and come back here for the August meeting - Philip Fenton, trainer.

runners.name: Willywampus
runners.comment: Largely below best last season; best form is over further too
runners.spotlight: Two wins over fences include 2m6f beginners here in 2023; light campaign last season when below best although fair effort at Limerick last month; trip on the short side and others with stronger claims.

runners.name: Prince Of Air
runners.comment: Didn't stay 2m4f latest; dual C&D winning chaser so respected back in trip
runners.spotlight: Three-time winning chaser including twice over C&D, notably last month when making all off 98; longer trip found him out at Killarney on latest but back to 2m makes him a definite contender given his record here.

runners.name: Itsalonglongroad
runners.comment: Front-runner a four-time winner here but below best of late and vulnerable
runners.spotlight: Versatile veteran whose ten career wins include here twice here over hurdles and fences and more recently Ballinrobe handicap chase (2m1f, good to yielding) last September off 101; front-runner below best of late and likely vulnerable in a competitive handicap.

quotes.race: Pickardstown Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The visor worked a treat today. Itsalonglongroad is an older horse and that is exactly what he needed. The lad who rode him the other day with a visor on said he ran away with him and I thought if he does that over 2 miles he mightn't get home but to be fair to him he jumped like a buck and kept going - Shane O'Callaghan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Littleton Handicap
quotes.quote: We knew Itsalonglongroad had the ability to do it but he needed to show it on the day. Dylan (Browne McMonagle) gave him a super ride. At Listowel he overreached at the third-last and Shane (O'Callaghan) made a good decision to pull him up and wait for another day. He'll go to Killarney on Monday for another handicap - Patrick O'Leary, owner.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Itsalonglongroad was very good. He's not an easy horse to settle so the fact that he jumped so well meant we could make use of it. I got an easy time in front and he galloped all the way to the line - Mark Bolger, rider

quotes.race: Brennan's Pharmacy Tramore Handicap
quotes.quote: The track suits him and the early pace also helped him to settle, as did the absence of stalls. The ground is probably a shade on the easy side now which he seemed to really enjoy. Ross Coakley, winning jockey on ITSALONGLONGROAD

quotes.race: Tote Proud Sponsors Of Ballinrobe Racecourse Maiden
quotes.quote: Itsalonglongroad deserved that. His main problem is that he is hard on himself. We've been trying to drop him in and it hasn't worked, but he got a good ride from Ross and he kept at it well. I think the hold-up tactics will be abandoned for now - John McConnell, trainer.

quotes.race: Bulmers Cider Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was the plan to make all. He raced very free in Down Royal, and he has been a keen horse at home. We said we'd put the hood on him today and make the running, thankfully it has worked out - Mark Bolger, rider

runners.name: Red Striker
runners.comment: Soundly beaten on recent C&D comeback run; bit to prove right now
runners.spotlight: Versatile 10yo with wins on flat, over hurdles and Ballinrobe handicap chase back in 2022; lightly raced of late, returning from 199-day absence when soundly beaten over hurdles here last month; bit to prove right now.

quotes.race: Dar Golf Construction Handicap
quotes.quote: Today was genuinely only a fact-finding day. He's done a few pieces of work but we're only learning about him like everyone else. Colin said they went no gallop, which, in hindsight, wouldn't have suited him but he liked the ground, which is a positive. We thought at home that a mile and two furlongs is no problem to him, I'd say in time when we step him up into a higher grade of a race and they go a good honest gallop, that might suit him. He was honest today and we'll take the positives out of it. Fitness-wise he'll improve - we definitely haven't cooked him - and it was a good day out for him - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer of Red Striker

6:45.race_name: Walsh King Accountants Mares Maiden Hurdle
6:45.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Selective watering)

runners.name: Call Me Rose
runners.comment: Pour Moi half-sister to point winner Givemylovetorose; worth a market watch on debut
runners.spotlight: Pour Moi half-sister to point winner Givemylovetorose; dam point-to-point winner, half-sister to bumper/2m6f-3m3f hurdle winner Rosarian; worth a market watch on debut.

runners.name: Derryville
runners.comment: Solid level of form in bumpers so considered now on hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: Has put up several solid efforts in bumpers, notably 5l defeat by dual Grade 1 winner Bambino Fever at Punchestown; recent Downpatrick third not far off that form either and now switches attention to hurdles with claims in a weak enough maiden.

runners.name: Elusive Ruby
runners.comment: Beaten a long way in three bumpers, can only be watched on hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way in three bumpers, can only be watched on hurdles debut and not sure this extended trip will suit.

runners.name: Fairys Fortune
runners.comment: Nicely-bred local challenger worth a market check on debut
runners.spotlight: Soldier Of Fortune half-sister to winners Smitty Bacall (bumper and 2m4f-3m2f hurdle/chase), Palm Sur (bumper) and Sullivan's Brow (point/2m hurdle); dam placed in point, closely related to bumper and smart 2m-2m6f hurdle/chase winner Blazing Tempo; nicely-bred local challenger worth a market check on debut.

runners.name: Julie Liath
runners.comment: Placed pointer ran okay on recent bumper debut; should relish this trip
runners.spotlight: Veteran mare, placed in two of three point-to-points since belated debut in March; wasn't discredited on recent bumper debut when beaten 8l in 2m2f Tipperary pointers' event and should appreciate this trip now switched to hurdles.

runners.name: Lastofthecitizens
runners.comment: Point-to-point form doesn't amount to much; hooded here for rules debut
runners.spotlight: Imperial Monarch 6yo is first foal of a point-to-point winner, a half-sister to 2m4f-3m1f hurdle/chase winner Parkinson, from family of Cheltenham Foxhunter winner Lovely Citizen; point-to-point form doesn't amount to much; hooded here for rules debut.

runners.name: Prized Jet
runners.comment: Point-to-point second made 21,000euros; one to consider on rules debut
runners.spotlight: Jet Away mare is first foal of an unraced sister to useful 2m-2m7f hurdle/chase winner Lucid Dreams, from family of high-class 2m-3m5f hurdler/chaser Monkerhostin; runner-up on debut in Ballyknock mares' maiden point-to-point last month before fetching 21,000euros at Goresbridge a week later; one to consider on rules debut.

runners.name: Quarry Tiepy
runners.comment: Mammoth absence since points' win; Townend preferring Sugar Cookie but don't dismiss
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to point-to-point winner Battys Dilemma; dam unraced half-sister to bumper/2m5f hurdle/3m chase winner Coastal Tiep, from family of smart chaser Pomme Tiepy; absent since winning Ballindenisk mares maiden point-to-point for Paul O'Flynn back in December 2022 (soft); one of three runners for the Mullins' yard, Townend prefers Sugar Cookie but don't dismiss.

runners.name: Shell Be Kept
runners.comment: Ground probably too quick on latest; place claims at best back in a maiden
runners.spotlight: Chased home a clear all-the-way winner in 2m5f Limerick claiming hurdle in January (heavy) on final start for Sean Allen and not far off that level when beaten 15l in stronger 2m3f Cork mares maiden but below best on recent handicap debut on quicker ground; place claims at best back in a maiden.

runners.name: Sip Sip Hooray
runners.comment: Disappointing favourite in Kilbeggan mares bumper; surely capable of better
runners.spotlight: Walk In The Park mare cost 115,000Euros as a 3yo; third foal; half-sister to winners Waldlicht (French 8.5f AW 2yo) and Home Free (2m hurdle/chase); dam placed 1m4f (RPR 72), half-sister to Group-placed Flat and useful 2m-2m4f jumps winner Landofhopeandglory; reportedly never travelled when bitterly disappointing favourite on debut in Kilbeggan mares bumper last month; surely capable of better.

runners.name: Sugar Cookie
runners.comment: Bumper promise yet to materialise over hurdles but Townend remains loyal
runners.spotlight: Promise on debut in 2m Leopardstown bumper on yielding for Nina Walsh in March 2023; off 728 days and has yet to reproduce that level of form in three runs for current yard, far from fluent when pulled up in Kilbeggan mares maiden on latest; hasn't looked a natural jumper to-date but Townend remains loyal.

runners.name: Two Become One
runners.comment: Entitled to come on from recent comeback run; claims on last year's Kilbeggan second
runners.spotlight: Displayed definite ability when runner-up (after 173-day absence) in 2m3f Kilbeggan maiden last year (good-to-yielding) but didn't really count after further year's absence at Sligo earlier this month; entitled to come on for that so don't rule out.

runners.name: Veras Bar
runners.comment: Never sighted on debut in Tipperary bumper last summer; best watched on return
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; sister to 2m/2m1f hurdle winner Dave And Bernie; dam unraced; never sighted on debut in Tipperary bumper last summer; best watched on return.

7:20.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Selective watering)

runners.name: Bob The Builder
runners.comment: Has finished tailed off in two chases and a maiden hurdle since returning to rules
runners.spotlight: Dual point winner but has finished tailed off in two chases and a maiden hurdle since returning to rules.

runners.name: Halla Paroiste
runners.comment: Unlikely that he gave his running when tailed off in his previous handicap
runners.spotlight: Unlikely that he gave his running when tailed off in his previous handicap and made the frame in a maiden here in October (final run); does have his stamina to prove over this far and now goes in cheekpieces.

runners.name: Dees Getaway
runners.comment: Won her maiden over C&D on good ground last September but hasn't kicked on from there
runners.spotlight: Won her maiden over C&D on good ground last September but hasn't kicked on from there, in a handicap hurdle and three runs over fences; cheekpieces are now turned to.

runners.name: Trooper Carton
runners.comment: Finished third in a 2m maiden here before a 24l defeat at Kilbeggan (2m3f)
runners.spotlight: Only 1-14 in points; finished third in a 2m maiden here before a 24l defeat at Kilbeggan (2m3f); difficult to know what to expect after those contrasting fortunes but should stay this far.

runners.name: Mags Nelson
runners.comment: Midfield in his maidens but caught the eye on handicap debut at Cork; entered Thursday
runners.spotlight: Midfield in his maidens but caught the eye on handicap debut at Cork (2m4f, good) when staying on strongly from off the pace; respected; reserve in 7.42 at Limerick on Thursday.

runners.name: Nevereverever
runners.comment: Poor return at Tipperary but he was runner-up in 2m4f/3m1f handicaps last autumn
runners.spotlight: Poor return at Tipperary but he was runner-up in 2m4f/3m1f handicaps last autumn so can't be ruled out.

runners.name: Bite That
runners.owner: Mrs Patrick J Flynn & Gavin Omahoney
runners.comment: Chase winner in March and another good effort back over hurdles at Clonmel; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Infrequent winner but consistent in the main and deserved his chase victory in March (2m3f); another good effort back over hurdles at Clonmel; in the mix.

runners.name: Yorkshire Escape
runners.comment: Quirky, having refused and ran out in points this year; well held in recent hurdles
runners.spotlight: Quirky, having refused and ran out in points this year; well beaten in handicap hurdles the last twice.

runners.name: Ag Obair Go Crua
runners.comment: Not had a lot of racing but has offered very little in his three handicap hurdles
runners.spotlight: Not had a lot of racing but has offered very little in his three handicap hurdles.

runners.name: Phildante
runners.comment: Made an underwhelming handicap debut at Cork (2m4f; 33-1)
runners.spotlight: Placed in bumpers for previous yard; 0-4 for this one and made an underwhelming handicap debut at Cork (2m4f; 33-1).

runners.name: Beechroad Winnie
runners.comment: Only 3l away over C&D last June on her return from a similar break
runners.spotlight: Remains a maiden but has finished runner-up four times so capable of winning races and was only 3l away over C&D last June on her return from a similar break; respected with a good jockey booking.

runners.name: Roman Parish
runners.comment: He's now 0-32 under rules and his latest third over fences was fairly remote
runners.spotlight: Runs well now and again but he's now 0-32 under rules and his latest third over fences was fairly remote.

runners.name: Run Away Merida
runners.comment: Uncompetitive in maidens and even this low a mark on handicap debut might not be generous
runners.spotlight: Uncompetitive in her maidens and even this low a mark on handicap debut might not be generous.

runners.name: Keep D Change
runners.comment: Poor form in maidens and makes handicap debut after a mammoth absence; changed yards
runners.spotlight: Poor form in maidens and makes handicap debut after a mammoth absence; changed yards.

runners.name: Menas Miracle
runners.comment: Low-grade handicaps were always going to be more like it; check the betting
runners.spotlight: Couldn't get remotely excited about her qualifying runs but low-grade handicaps were always going to be more like it; check the betting.

runners.name: The Border Boy
runners.comment: Beaten only 5l in this 12 months ago but that was his last effort of any real note
runners.spotlight: Beaten only 5l in this 12 months ago but that was his last effort of any real note; still commands some respect back here and goes in new cheekpieces.

runners.name: Shing Shilla
runners.breeder: Lynch Bages Ltd & Edge Ridge Ltd
runners.comment: Reserve; beaten under 8l last time at Ballinrobe and appears to be finding her level
runners.spotlight: Reserve; beaten under 8l last time at Ballinrobe (2m6f, good) and appears to be finding her level.

runners.name: Mother Ship
runners.comment: Reserve; below par latest but has a race in her off this sort of mark; entered Thursday
runners.spotlight: Reserve; has a race in her off this sort of mark and a lot better was expected at Down Royal last time; entered 7.42 at Limerick on Thursday.

runners.name: Tea It Is
runners.comment: Reserve; tailed off when falling on his stable debut; seventh at Limerick on Thursday (6.42).
runners.spotlight: Reserve; tailed off when falling on his stable debut at Tipperary; seventh at Limerick on Thursday (6.42).

7:55.race_name: SIS Supporting Irish Racing Handicap Hurdle
7:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Selective watering)

runners.name: Bowensonfire
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: Brings form momentum and potential into handicaps, though has been off for three months
runners.spotlight: Easily won a maiden at Limerick (2m, heavy) and, although turned over at long odds-on in a novice at Ayr (2m, heavy), the winner was bang in form and has won since; he'll be fine on this drier ground and should have a part to play on handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: He wasn't a bumper horse so he's much better than the bare form of his run at Roscommon. Expect him to leave that form well behind when he goes over hurdles. 28-10-24

runners.name: Hasten Slowly

prev_owners.owner: Mrs M Cahill & Mrs Caroline Hendron & Ciaran Kennelly

runners.comment: Won at Punchestown last October and this would be most realistic opportunity since then
runners.spotlight: Unseated midrace at Killarney last time when up against it in a Listed race; won her only previous handicap start at Punchestown last October when 5lb lower; this would be her most realistic opportunity since then.

quotes.race: Bluegrass Horse Feeds Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Hasten Slowly relaxed well through the race and hit the line well. Her jumping was very good and she got the trip well. Hopefully she can win another few - Ben Harvey, rider

quotes.race: Lucan Bloodstock Build For The Boys Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Hasten Slowly was one I thought would climb last year but she went backwards. I think she will improve going out in trip and she loves fast ground. Hopefully she will go on from this - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: A lot of our two-year-olds have been running well without winning. We think Hasten Slowly is quite nice and Encosta is very nice as well. Just because they've been running so green, when we run them, I said we'd better run the other one as well. Colin (Keane) said she's still very laid-back, he always thought he had the runner-up covered but then she dawdled about a little late on. She's a nice, strong filly and loves fast ground - Noel Meade, trainer

runners.name: Mercury Mission
runners.breeder: Flaxman Stables Ireland Limited & R Cantoni
runners.comment: Back-to-back handicap wins before a respectable sixth of 22 off this mark at Punchestown
runners.spotlight: Back-to-back handicap wins at Wexford and Limerick before a respectable sixth of 22 off this mark at Punchestown; that was no backward step.

runners.name: Newtown Rambler
runners.comment: Maiden winner and there have been feasible excuses in his two handicaps
runners.spotlight: Second in a Downpatrick maiden (good) before going one better at Sligo (yielding); feasible excuses in his handicaps as faced a tough task in the first and probably found the ground too testing last time; could go well.

runners.name: Miss Dishy
runners.comment: Might not want the ground too soft which would excuse her last two runs
runners.spotlight: Bumper/maiden winner; might not want the ground too soft which would excuse her last two runs, the latest her handicap debut; better expected.

runners.name: Pidoyne
runners.comment: C&D winner; had an excuse on her final run here and has gone well fresh in the past
runners.spotlight: C&D winner and back to her best when scoring at Roscommon last June; had an excuse on her final run here and has gone well fresh in the past.

runners.name: Star Official
runners.comment: Finished last on the Flat nine days ago but stormed in a handicap here the run before
runners.spotlight: Never better than when winning a C&D handicap by 10l in April (yielding); 8lb higher this time and has since finished last on the Flat, but hard to dismiss.

runners.name: Tingarran Express
runners.comment: Clonmel winner when left clear but has twice come up short off this 5lb higher mark
runners.spotlight: Left in the lead when winning at Clonmel (2m2f, good) and has twice come up short off this 5lb higher mark; might be vulnerable once more.

8:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Selective watering)

runners.name: Chosen Leader
runners.comment: Modest points' form and beaten a long way on bumper debut at Down Royal last week
runners.spotlight: Dam has produced winners and is an unraced half-sister to Champion Bumper winner Cousin Vinny; modest point-to-point form and beaten a long way on bumper debut at Down Royal last week; best watched.

runners.name: Faithful Follower
runners.comment: Disappointing odds-on over hurdles latest but previous bumper form gives him claims
runners.spotlight: Much the best of five bumper runs when clear second at Down Royal last autumn (good-to-yielding); possibly made too much use of on recent hurdles debut (odds-on) at Sligo, has to be considered reverting to bumper here.

runners.name: Goodmancon
runners.comment: C&D third last October but recent Killarney comeback run a long way below that level
runners.spotlight: Sent off at big prices for all four bumper starts, showing some promise when third over C&D in October; recent Killarney comeback run a long way below that level.

runners.name: Larkfield Lidaho
runners.comment: Pulled-up on maiden point-to-point start in March; unlikely to feature
runners.spotlight: Dam unraced sister to 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Springfield Lodge and closely related to 2m6f hurdle winner Toad Hall; pulled-up on maiden point-to-point start in March; unlikely to feature.

runners.name: Lord Ffrench
runners.comment: Promise on opening two runs last summer but below that form final start; may need this
runners.spotlight: Promise on opening two runs last summer at Cork and Roscommon, well below that level at Downpatrick in September when last seen; may need this.

runners.name: Texas Red
runners.breeder: S N C Scuderia Micolo Di Nicola Galli Ec
runners.comment: Newcomer best watched unless market suggests otherwise
runners.spotlight: Planteur 5yo made 15,000Euros as a yearling; brother to Italian Grade 2 2m1f hurdle winner Edidindo; dam placed on Flat in Italy; newcomer best watched unless market suggests otherwise.

runners.name: Loup De Thaix
runners.breeder: M Michel Bourgneuf & Mme Elisabeth Sasmbardier
runners.comment: Pulled up on both point-to-point runs, best watched on rules debut
runners.spotlight: Robin Du Nord 4yo cost 9,000Euros as a foal; first foal of an AQPS Flat/2m5f chase winner; pulled up on both point-to-point runs, best watched on rules debut.

runners.name: Love Me Tender
runners.breeder: Mme Henri Devin, M Henri Francois Devin & M Francois Nicolle
runners.comment: Brother to French bumper winner Kainsbourg; obvious appeal from top yard
runners.spotlight: Doctor Dino gelding cost 110,000Euros as a 2yo; second foal; brother to 1m3f/1m7f AQPS Flat winner and placed hurdler Kainsbourg; dam useful French 2m-2m3f hurdle/chase winner; won't have to be too much out of the ordinary to make a winning start.

runners.name: Mystical Madness
runners.comment: Beaten a long way on Clonmel bumper debut earlier this month; tongue-tie tried
runners.spotlight: Axxos gelding cost 7,500euros as a foal; third foal; dam unraced half-sister to 2m4f-3m4f hurdle/chase winner Riverside City; pulled up on debut for Thomas Byrne in Lingstown point-to-point in March and beaten a long way on Clonmel bumper debut earlier this month, albeit not without market support; tongue-tie tried.

runners.name: Annie Hope Harriet
runners.comment: Well held twice bumpers late last summer; can only be watched on return
runners.spotlight: Well held twice bumpers late last summer; can only be watched on return.

runners.name: Mollys Dolly
runners.comment: Some debut promise but little since; tongue-tie now tried.
runners.spotlight: Showed a bit of potential on debut in a Naas bumper but has struggled in three runs since, last two in maiden hurdles; tongue-tie now tried.

runners.name: Palpatate
runners.comment: Thurles run a step up on Limerick debut effort but lots more likely required here
runners.spotlight: Thurles run a step up on Limerick debut effort but lots more likely required here.

runners.name: Maybe Someday
runners.comment: Newcomer likely best watched unless market speaks
runners.spotlight: Affinsea filly is third foal of an unraced half-sister to winners Annacotty (high-class 2m-3m hurdle/chase), Bob Will (2m4f-3m chase) and Silent Cliche (3m chase); newcomer likely best watched unless market speaks.
